Definition: libmesh_common.h:100
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::create_submesh ( UnstructuredMesh &  new_mesh,
const const_element_iterator &  it,
const const_element_iterator &  it_end 
) const

Constructs a mesh called "new_mesh" from the current mesh by iterating over the elements between it and it_end and adding them to the new mesh.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 974 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem(), libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers(), libMesh::MeshBase::add_point(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::add_side(), libMesh::as_range(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::boundary_ids(), libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_remote_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::merge_extra_integer_names(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::MeshBase::query_node_ptr(), libMesh::DofObject::set_extra_integer(), libMesh::Elem::set_node() , 以及 libMesh::DofObject::set_unique_id().

参考自 create_pid_mesh().

977 {
978  // Just in case the subdomain_mesh already has some information
979  // in it, get rid of it.
980  new_mesh.clear();
981 
982  // If we're not serial, our submesh isn't either.
983  // There are no remote elements to delete on an empty mesh, but
984  // calling the method to do so marks the mesh as parallel.
985  if (!this->is_serial())
986  new_mesh.delete_remote_elements();
987 
988  // Fail if (*this == new_mesh), we cannot create a submesh inside ourself!
989  // This may happen if the user accidentally passes the original mesh into
990  // this function! We will check this by making sure we did not just
991  // clear ourself.
992  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (this->n_nodes(), 0);
993  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (this->n_elem(), 0);
994 
995  // Container to catch boundary IDs handed back by BoundaryInfo
996  std::vector<boundary_id_type> bc_ids;
997 
998  // Put any extra integers on the new mesh too
999  new_mesh.merge_extra_integer_names(*this);
1000  const unsigned int n_node_ints = _node_integer_names.size(),
1001  n_elem_ints = _elem_integer_names.size();
1002 
1003  for (const auto & old_elem : as_range(it, it_end))
1004  {
1005  // Add an equivalent element type to the new_mesh.
1006  // Copy ids for this element.
1007  auto uelem = Elem::build(old_elem->type());
1008  uelem->set_id() = old_elem->id();
1009 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1010  uelem->set_unique_id(old_elem->unique_id());
1011 #endif
1012  uelem->subdomain_id() = old_elem->subdomain_id();
1013  uelem->processor_id() = old_elem->processor_id();
1014 
1015  uelem->add_extra_integers(n_elem_ints);
1016  for (unsigned int i = 0; i != n_elem_ints; ++i)
1017  uelem->set_extra_integer(i, old_elem->get_extra_integer(i));
1018 
1019  uelem->set_mapping_type(old_elem->mapping_type());
1020  uelem->set_mapping_data(old_elem->mapping_data());
1021 
1022  Elem * new_elem = new_mesh.add_elem(std::move(uelem));
1023 
1024  libmesh_assert(new_elem);
1025 
1026  // Loop over the nodes on this element.
1027  for (auto n : old_elem->node_index_range())
1028  {
1029  const dof_id_type this_node_id = old_elem->node_id(n);
1030 
1031  // Add this node to the new mesh if it's not there already
1032  if (!new_mesh.query_node_ptr(this_node_id))
1033  {
1034  Node * newn =
1035  new_mesh.add_point (old_elem->point(n),
1036  this_node_id,
1037  old_elem->node_ptr(n)->processor_id());
1038 
1039  newn->add_extra_integers(n_node_ints);
1040  for (unsigned int i = 0; i != n_node_ints; ++i)
1041  newn->set_extra_integer(i, old_elem->node_ptr(n)->get_extra_integer(i));
1042 
1043 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1044  newn->set_unique_id(old_elem->node_ptr(n)->unique_id());
1045 #endif
1046  }
1047 
1048  // Define this element's connectivity on the new mesh
1049  new_elem->set_node(n) = new_mesh.node_ptr(this_node_id);
1050  }
1051 
1052  // Maybe add boundary conditions for this element
1053  for (auto s : old_elem->side_index_range())
1054  {
1055  this->get_boundary_info().boundary_ids(old_elem, s, bc_ids);
1056  new_mesh.get_boundary_info().add_side (new_elem, s, bc_ids);
1057  }
1058  } // end loop over elements
1059 
1060  // Prepare the new_mesh for use
1061  new_mesh.prepare_for_use();
1062 }

ElemMappingType libMesh::MeshBase::default_mapping_type ( ) const
inlineinherited

Returns the default master space to physical space mapping basis functions to be used on newly added elements.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 787 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_default_mapping_type.

libMesh::MeshBase::_default_mapping_type
ElemMappingType _default_mapping_type
The default mapping type (typically Lagrange) between master and physical space to assign to newly ad...
Definition: mesh_base.h:1773
virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::delete_elem ( Elem *  e)
pure virtualinherited

Removes element e from the mesh.

This method must be implemented in derived classes in such a way that it does not invalidate element iterators. Users should call MeshBase::prepare_for_use() after elements are added to and/or deleted from the mesh.

注解
Calling this method may produce isolated nodes, i.e. nodes not connected to any element.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::all_tri(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube(), libMesh::MeshTools::clear_spline_nodes(), contract(), libMesh::TetGenMeshInterface::delete_2D_hull_elements(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::flatten(), libMesh::Poly2TriTriangulator::insert_refinement_points(), libMesh::TetGenMeshInterface::pointset_convexhull(), libMesh::AbaqusIO::read() , 以及 libMesh::UNVIO::read_implementation().

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node ( Node *  n)
pure virtualinherited

Removes the Node n from the mesh.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 all_first_order(), libMesh::MeshTools::clear_spline_nodes(), libMesh::TriangulatorInterface::elems_to_segments(), libMesh::MeshBase::remove_orphaned_nodes() , 以及 stitching_helper().

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::delete_remote_elements ( )
inlinevirtualinherited

When supported, deletes all nonlocal elements of the mesh except for "ghosts" which touch a local element, and deletes all nodes which are not part of a local or ghost element.

被 libMesh::DistributedMesh 重载.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 243 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_extrusion(), create_submesh(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::Nemesis_IO::read(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::sync() , 以及 libMesh::MeshSerializer::~MeshSerializer().

243 {}
void libMesh::MeshBase::detect_interior_parents ( )
inherited

Search the mesh for elements that have a neighboring element of dim+1 and set that element as the interior parent.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1722 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_dimensions(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_ref(), libMesh::make_range() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::max_elem_id().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use().

1723 {
1724  // This requires an inspection on every processor
1725  parallel_object_only();
1726 
1727  // Check if the mesh contains mixed dimensions. If so, then set interior parents, otherwise return.
1728  if (this->elem_dimensions().size() == 1)
1729  return;
1730 
1731  //This map will be used to set interior parents
1732  std::unordered_map<dof_id_type, std::vector<dof_id_type>> node_to_elem;
1733 
1734  for (const auto & elem : this->active_element_ptr_range())
1735  {
1736  // Populating the node_to_elem map, same as MeshTools::build_nodes_to_elem_map
1737  for (auto n : make_range(elem->n_vertices()))
1738  {
1739  libmesh_assert_less (elem->id(), this->max_elem_id());
1740 
1741  node_to_elem[elem->node_id(n)].push_back(elem->id());
1742  }
1743  }
1744 
1745  // Automatically set interior parents
1746  for (const auto & element : this->element_ptr_range())
1747  {
1748  // Ignore an 3D element or an element that already has an interior parent
1749  if (element->dim()>=LIBMESH_DIM || element->interior_parent())
1750  continue;
1751 
1752  // Start by generating a SET of elements that are dim+1 to the current
1753  // element at each vertex of the current element, thus ignoring interior nodes.
1754  // If one of the SET of elements is empty, then we will not have an interior parent
1755  // since an interior parent must be connected to all vertices of the current element
1756  std::vector<std::set<dof_id_type>> neighbors( element->n_vertices() );
1757 
1758  bool found_interior_parents = false;
1759 
1760  for (auto n : make_range(element->n_vertices()))
1761  {
1762  std::vector<dof_id_type> & element_ids = node_to_elem[element->node_id(n)];
1763  for (const auto & eid : element_ids)
1764  if (this->elem_ref(eid).dim() == element->dim()+1)
1765  neighbors[n].insert(eid);
1766 
1767  if (neighbors[n].size()>0)
1768  {
1769  found_interior_parents = true;
1770  }
1771  else
1772  {
1773  // We have found an empty set, no reason to continue
1774  // Ensure we set this flag to false before the break since it could have
1775  // been set to true for previous vertex
1776  found_interior_parents = false;
1777  break;
1778  }
1779  }
1780 
1781  // If we have successfully generated a set of elements for each vertex, we will compare
1782  // the set for vertex 0 will the sets for the vertices until we find a id that exists in
1783  // all sets. If found, this is our an interior parent id. The interior parent id found
1784  // will be the lowest element id if there is potential for multiple interior parents.
1785  if (found_interior_parents)
1786  {
1787  std::set<dof_id_type> & neighbors_0 = neighbors[0];
1788  for (const auto & interior_parent_id : neighbors_0)
1789  {
1790  found_interior_parents = false;
1791  for (auto n : make_range(1u, element->n_vertices()))
1792  {
1793  if (neighbors[n].find(interior_parent_id)!=neighbors[n].end())
1794  {
1795  found_interior_parents=true;
1796  }
1797  else
1798  {
1799  found_interior_parents=false;
1800  break;
1801  }
1802  }
1803  if (found_interior_parents)
1804  {
1805  element->set_interior_parent(this->elem_ptr(interior_parent_id));
1806  break;
1807  }
1808  }
1809  }
1810  }
1811 }
libMesh::MeshBase::max_elem_id

The 2-parameter make_range() helper function returns an IntRange&lt;T&gt; when both input parameters are of...

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::elem_ptr().

625  {
626  return *this->elem_ptr(i);

libMesh::MeshBase::elem_ptr
virtual const Elem * elem_ptr(const dof_id_type i) const =0
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::find_neighbors ( const bool  reset_remote_elements = false,
const bool  reset_current_list = true 
)
overridevirtual

Other functions from MeshBase requiring re-definition.

Here we look at all of the child elements which don't already have valid neighbors.

If a child element has a nullptr neighbor it is either because it is on the boundary or because its neighbor is at a different level. In the latter case we must get the neighbor from the parent.

If a child element has a remote_elem neighbor on a boundary it shares with its parent, that info may have become out-dated through coarsening of the neighbor's parent. In this case, if the parent's neighbor is active then the child should share it.

Furthermore, that neighbor better be active, otherwise we missed a child somewhere.

We also need to look through children ordered by increasing refinement level in order to add new interior_parent() links in boundary elements which have just been generated by refinement, and fix links in boundary elements whose previous interior_parent() has just been coarsened away.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 530 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::ancestor(), libMesh::as_range(), libMesh::Elem::child_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::child_ref_range(), libMesh::err, libMesh::Elem::has_children(), libMesh::Elem::hmin(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::Elem::interior_parent(), libMesh::Elem::is_ancestor_of(), libMesh::Elem::is_child_on_side(), libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_amr_interior_parents(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_neighbors(), libMesh::Elem::n_children(), libMesh::MeshTools::n_levels(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr_range(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::Elem::set_interior_parent(), libMesh::Elem::set_neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::side_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::subactive(), libMesh::TOLERANCE, libMesh::Elem::vertex_average(), libMesh::Elem::which_child_am_i() , 以及 libMesh::NameBasedIO::write().

参考自 libMesh::TriangleWrapper::copy_tri_to_mesh(), libMesh::Poly2TriTriangulator::insert_refinement_points() , 以及 libMesh::DistributedMesh::redistribute().

532 {
533  // We might actually want to run this on an empty mesh
534  // (e.g. the boundary mesh for a nonexistent bcid!)
535  // libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (this->n_nodes(), 0);
536  // libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (this->n_elem(), 0);
537 
538  // This function must be run on all processors at once
539  parallel_object_only();
540 
541  LOG_SCOPE("find_neighbors()", "Mesh");
542 
543  //TODO:[BSK] This should be removed later?!
544  if (reset_current_list)
545  for (const auto & e : this->element_ptr_range())
546  for (auto s : e->side_index_range())
547  if (e->neighbor_ptr(s) != remote_elem || reset_remote_elements)
548  e->set_neighbor(s, nullptr);
549 
550  // Find neighboring elements by first finding elements
551  // with identical side keys and then check to see if they
552  // are neighbors
553  {
554  // data structures -- Use the hash_multimap if available
555  typedef dof_id_type key_type;
556  typedef std::pair<Elem *, unsigned char> val_type;
557  typedef std::unordered_multimap<key_type, val_type> map_type;
558 
559  // A map from side keys to corresponding elements & side numbers
560  map_type side_to_elem_map;
561 
562  // Pull objects out of the loop to reduce heap operations
563  std::unique_ptr<Elem> my_side, their_side;
564 
565  for (const auto & element : this->element_ptr_range())
566  {
567  for (auto ms : element->side_index_range())
568  {
569  next_side:
570  // If we haven't yet found a neighbor on this side, try.
571  // Even if we think our neighbor is remote, that
572  // information may be out of date.
573  if (element->neighbor_ptr(ms) == nullptr ||
574  element->neighbor_ptr(ms) == remote_elem)
575  {
576  // Get the key for the side of this element
577  const dof_id_type key = element->key(ms);
578 
579  // Look for elements that have an identical side key
580  auto bounds = side_to_elem_map.equal_range(key);
581 
582  // May be multiple keys, check all the possible
583  // elements which _might_ be neighbors.
584  if (bounds.first != bounds.second)
585  {
586  // Get the side for this element
587  element->side_ptr(my_side, ms);
588 
589  // Look at all the entries with an equivalent key
590  while (bounds.first != bounds.second)
591  {
592  // Get the potential element
593  Elem * neighbor = bounds.first->second.first;
594 
595  // Get the side for the neighboring element
596  const unsigned int ns = bounds.first->second.second;
597  neighbor->side_ptr(their_side, ns);
598  //libmesh_assert(my_side.get());
599  //libmesh_assert(their_side.get());
600 
601  // If found a match with my side
602  //
603  // In 1D, since parents and children have an
604  // equal side (i.e. a node) we need to check
605  // for matching level() to avoid setting our
606  // neighbor pointer to any of our neighbor's
607  // descendants.
608  if ((*my_side == *their_side) &&
609  (element->level() == neighbor->level()))
610  {
611  // So share a side. Is this a mixed pair
612  // of subactive and active/ancestor
613  // elements?
614  // If not, then we're neighbors.
615  // If so, then the subactive's neighbor is
616 
617  if (element->subactive() ==
618  neighbor->subactive())
619  {
620  // an element is only subactive if it has
621  // been coarsened but not deleted
622  element->set_neighbor (ms,neighbor);
623  neighbor->set_neighbor(ns,element);
624  }
625  else if (element->subactive())
626  {
627  element->set_neighbor(ms,neighbor);
628  }
629  else if (neighbor->subactive())
630  {
631  neighbor->set_neighbor(ns,element);
632  }
633  side_to_elem_map.erase (bounds.first);
634 
635  // get out of this nested crap
636  goto next_side;
637  }
638 
639  ++bounds.first;
640  }
641  }
642 
643  // didn't find a match...
644  // Build the map entry for this element
645  side_to_elem_map.emplace
646  (key, std::make_pair(element, cast_int<unsigned char>(ms)));
647  }
648  }
649  }
650  }
651 
652 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
653 
681  const unsigned int n_levels = MeshTools::n_levels(*this);
682  for (unsigned int level = 1; level < n_levels; ++level)
683  {
684  for (auto & current_elem : as_range(level_elements_begin(level),
685  level_elements_end(level)))
686  {
687  libmesh_assert(current_elem);
688  Elem * parent = current_elem->parent();
689  libmesh_assert(parent);
690  const unsigned int my_child_num = parent->which_child_am_i(current_elem);
691 
692  for (auto s : current_elem->side_index_range())
693  {
694  if (current_elem->neighbor_ptr(s) == nullptr ||
695  (current_elem->neighbor_ptr(s) == remote_elem &&
696  parent->is_child_on_side(my_child_num, s)))
697  {
698  Elem * neigh = parent->neighbor_ptr(s);
699 
700  // If neigh was refined and had non-subactive children
701  // made remote earlier, then our current elem should
702  // actually have one of those remote children as a
703  // neighbor
704  if (neigh &&
705  (neigh->ancestor() ||
706  // If neigh has subactive children which should have
707  // matched as neighbors of the current element but
708  // did not, then those likewise must be remote
709  // children.
710  (current_elem->subactive() && neigh->has_children() &&
711  (neigh->level()+1) == current_elem->level())))
712  {
713 #ifdef DEBUG
714  // Let's make sure that "had children made remote"
715  // situation is actually the case
716  libmesh_assert(neigh->has_children());
717  bool neigh_has_remote_children = false;
718  for (auto & child : neigh->child_ref_range())
719  if (&child == remote_elem)
720  neigh_has_remote_children = true;
721  libmesh_assert(neigh_has_remote_children);
722 
723  // And let's double-check that we don't have
724  // a remote_elem neighboring an active local element
725  if (current_elem->active())
726  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (current_elem->processor_id(),
727  this->processor_id());
728 #endif // DEBUG
729  neigh = const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem);
730  }
731  // If neigh and current_elem are more than one level
732  // apart, figuring out whether we have a remote
733  // neighbor here becomes much harder.
734  else if (neigh && (current_elem->subactive() &&
735  neigh->has_children()))
736  {
737  // Find the deepest descendant of neigh which
738  // we could consider for a neighbor. If we run
739  // out of neigh children, then that's our
740  // neighbor. If we find a potential neighbor
741  // with remote_children and we don't find any
742  // potential neighbors among its non-remote
743  // children, then our neighbor must be remote.
744  while (neigh != remote_elem &&
745  neigh->has_children())
746  {
747  bool found_neigh = false;
748  for (unsigned int c = 0, nc = neigh->n_children();
749  !found_neigh && c != nc; ++c)
750  {
751  Elem * child = neigh->child_ptr(c);
752  if (child == remote_elem)
753  continue;
754  for (auto ncn : child->neighbor_ptr_range())
755  {
756  if (ncn != remote_elem &&
757  ncn->is_ancestor_of(current_elem))
758  {
759  neigh = ncn;
760  found_neigh = true;
761  break;
762  }
763  }
764  }
765  if (!found_neigh)
766  neigh = const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem);
767  }
768  }
769  current_elem->set_neighbor(s, neigh);
770 #ifdef DEBUG
771  if (neigh != nullptr && neigh != remote_elem)
772  // We ignore subactive elements here because
773  // we don't care about neighbors of subactive element.
774  if ((!neigh->active()) && (!current_elem->subactive()))
775  {
776  libMesh::err << "On processor " << this->processor_id()
777  << std::endl;
778  libMesh::err << "Bad element ID = " << current_elem->id()
779  << ", Side " << s << ", Bad neighbor ID = " << neigh->id() << std::endl;
780  libMesh::err << "Bad element proc_ID = " << current_elem->processor_id()
781  << ", Bad neighbor proc_ID = " << neigh->processor_id() << std::endl;
782  libMesh::err << "Bad element size = " << current_elem->hmin()
783  << ", Bad neighbor size = " << neigh->hmin() << std::endl;
784  libMesh::err << "Bad element center = " << current_elem->vertex_average()
785  << ", Bad neighbor center = " << neigh->vertex_average() << std::endl;
786  libMesh::err << "ERROR: "
787  << (current_elem->active()?"Active":"Ancestor")
788  << " Element at level "
789  << current_elem->level() << std::endl;
790  libMesh::err << "with "
791  << (parent->active()?"active":
792  (parent->subactive()?"subactive":"ancestor"))
793  << " parent share "
794  << (neigh->subactive()?"subactive":"ancestor")
795  << " neighbor at level " << neigh->level()
796  << std::endl;
797  NameBasedIO(*this).write ("bad_mesh.gmv");
798  libmesh_error_msg("Problematic mesh written to bad_mesh.gmv.");
799  }
800 #endif // DEBUG
801  }
802  }
803 
804  // We can skip to the next element if we're full-dimension
805  // and therefore don't have any interior parents
806  if (current_elem->dim() >= LIBMESH_DIM)
807  continue;
808 
809  // We have no interior parents unless we can find one later
810  current_elem->set_interior_parent(nullptr);
811 
812  Elem * pip = parent->interior_parent();
813 
814  if (!pip)
815  continue;
816 
817  // If there's no interior_parent children, whether due to a
818  // remote element or a non-conformity, then there's no
819  // children to search.
820  if (pip == remote_elem || pip->active())
821  {
822  current_elem->set_interior_parent(pip);
823  continue;
824  }
825 
826  // For node comparisons we'll need a sensible tolerance
827  Real node_tolerance = current_elem->hmin() * TOLERANCE;
828 
829  // Otherwise our interior_parent should be a child of our
830  // parent's interior_parent.
831  for (auto & child : pip->child_ref_range())
832  {
833  // If we have a remote_elem, that might be our
834  // interior_parent. We'll set it provisionally now and
835  // keep trying to find something better.
836  if (&child == remote_elem)
837  {
838  current_elem->set_interior_parent
839  (const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
840  continue;
841  }
842 
843  bool child_contains_our_nodes = true;
844  for (auto & n : current_elem->node_ref_range())
845  {
846  bool child_contains_this_node = false;
847  for (auto & cn : child.node_ref_range())
848  if (cn.absolute_fuzzy_equals
849  (n, node_tolerance))
850  {
851  child_contains_this_node = true;
852  break;
853  }
854  if (!child_contains_this_node)
855  {
856  child_contains_our_nodes = false;
857  break;
858  }
859  }
860  if (child_contains_our_nodes)
861  {
862  current_elem->set_interior_parent(&child);
863  break;
864  }
865  }
866 
867  // We should have found *some* interior_parent at this
868  // point, whether semilocal or remote.
869  libmesh_assert(current_elem->interior_parent());
870  }
871  }
872 
873 #endif // AMR
874 
875 
876 #ifdef DEBUG
877  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_neighbors(*this,
878  !reset_remote_elements);
879  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_amr_interior_parents(*this);
880 #endif
881 }

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::fix_broken_node_and_element_numbering ( )
pure virtualinherited

There is no reason for a user to ever call this function.

This function restores a previously broken element/node numbering such that mesh.node_ref(n).id() == n.

void libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemsets ( dof_id_type  elemset_code,
MeshBase::elemset_type &  id_set_to_fill 
) const
inherited

Look up the element sets for a given elemset code and vice-versa.

The elemset must have been previously stored by calling add_elemset_code(). If no such code/set is found, returns the empty set or DofObject::invalid_id, respectively.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 379 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes.

参考自 stitching_helper(), libMesh::XdrIO::write() , 以及 libMesh::ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_elemsets().

380 {
381  // If we don't recognize this elemset_code, hand back an empty set
382  id_set_to_fill.clear();
383 
384  auto it = _elemset_codes.find(elemset_code);
385  if (it != _elemset_codes.end())
386  id_set_to_fill.insert(it->second->begin(), it->second->end());
387 }

subdomain_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::get_id_by_name ( std::string_view  name) const
inherited
返回
The id of the named subdomain if it exists, Elem::invalid_subdomain_id otherwise.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1632 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_block_id_to_name , 以及 libMesh::Elem::invalid_subdomain_id.

1633 {
1634  // Linear search over the map values.
1635  std::map<subdomain_id_type, std::string>::const_iterator
1636  iter = _block_id_to_name.begin(),
1637  end_iter = _block_id_to_name.end();
1638 
1639  for ( ; iter != end_iter; ++iter)
1640  if (iter->second == name)
1641  return iter->first;
1642 
1643  // If we made it here without returning, we don't have a subdomain
1644  // with the requested name, so return Elem::invalid_subdomain_id.
1645  return Elem::invalid_subdomain_id;
1646 }

Definition: mesh_base.h:1853
std::string libMesh::MeshBase::get_info ( const unsigned int  verbosity = 0,
const bool  global = true 
) const
inherited
返回
A string containing relevant information about the mesh.

verbosity sets the verbosity, with 0 being the least and 2 being the greatest. 0 - Dimensions, number of nodes, number of elems, number of subdomains, number of partitions, prepared status. 1 - Adds the mesh bounding box, mesh element types, specific nodesets/edgesets/sidesets with element types, number of nodes/edges/sides. 2 - Adds volume information and bounding boxes to boundary information.

The global parameter pertains primarily to verbosity levels 1 and above. When global == true, information is only output on rank 0 and the information is reduced. When global == false, information is output on all ranks that pertains only to that local partition.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1020 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_dims, libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes, libMesh::Elem::build_edge_ptr(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::MeshTools::create_bounding_box(), libMesh::MeshTools::create_local_bounding_box(), libMesh::MeshTools::elem_types(), libMesh::Utility::enum_to_string(), libMesh::for, libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_edge_boundary_ids(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_edgeset_name_map(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_node_boundary_ids(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_nodeset_name_map(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_side_boundary_ids(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_sideset_name_map(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_subdomain_name_map(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::MeshBase::is_prepared(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_replicated(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::loose_bounding_box(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_active_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_elemsets(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_local_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_local_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_local_subdomains(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_partitions(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_subdomains(), libMesh::n_threads(), libMesh::Quality::name(), libMesh::Elem::node_ref_range(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::MeshBase::spatial_dimension(), libMesh::Elem::type() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::volume().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::print_info().

1021 {
1022  std::ostringstream oss;
1023 
1024  oss << " Mesh Information:" << '\n';
1025 
1026  if (!_elem_dims.empty())
1027  {
1028  oss << " elem_dimensions()={";
1029  std::copy(_elem_dims.begin(),
1030  --_elem_dims.end(), // --end() is valid if the set is non-empty
1031  std::ostream_iterator<unsigned int>(oss, ", "));
1032  oss << cast_int<unsigned int>(*_elem_dims.rbegin());
1033  oss << "}\n";
1034  }
1035 
1036  oss << " spatial_dimension()=" << this->spatial_dimension() << '\n'
1037  << " n_nodes()=" << this->n_nodes() << '\n'
1038  << " n_local_nodes()=" << this->n_local_nodes() << '\n'
1039  << " n_elem()=" << this->n_elem() << '\n'
1040  << " n_local_elem()=" << this->n_local_elem() << '\n';
1041 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1042  oss << " n_active_elem()=" << this->n_active_elem() << '\n';
1043 #endif
1044  if (global)
1045  oss << " n_subdomains()=" << static_cast<std::size_t>(this->n_subdomains()) << '\n';
1046  else
1047  oss << " n_local_subdomains()= " << static_cast<std::size_t>(this->n_local_subdomains()) << '\n';
1048  oss << " n_elemsets()=" << static_cast<std::size_t>(this->n_elemsets()) << '\n';
1049  if (!_elemset_codes.empty())
1050  oss << " n_elemset_codes=" << _elemset_codes.size() << '\n';
1051  oss << " n_partitions()=" << static_cast<std::size_t>(this->n_partitions()) << '\n'
1052  << " n_processors()=" << static_cast<std::size_t>(this->n_processors()) << '\n'
1053  << " n_threads()=" << static_cast<std::size_t>(libMesh::n_threads()) << '\n'
1054  << " processor_id()=" << static_cast<std::size_t>(this->processor_id()) << '\n'
1055  << " is_prepared()=" << (this->is_prepared() ? "true" : "false") << '\n'
1056  << " is_replicated()=" << (this->is_replicated() ? "true" : "false") << '\n';
1057 
1058  if (verbosity > 0)
1059  {
1060  if (global)
1061  {
1062  libmesh_parallel_only(this->comm());
1063  if (this->processor_id() != 0)
1064  oss << "\n Detailed global get_info() (verbosity > 0) is reduced and output to only rank 0.";
1065  }
1066 
1067  // Helper for printing element types
1068  const auto elem_type_helper = [](const std::set<int> & elem_types) {
1069  std::stringstream ss;
1070  for (auto it = elem_types.begin(); it != elem_types.end();)
1071  {
1072  ss << Utility::enum_to_string((ElemType)*it);
1073  if (++it != elem_types.end())
1074  ss << ", ";
1075  }
1076  return ss.str();
1077  };
1078 
1079  // Helper for whether or not the given DofObject is to be included. If we're doing
1080  // a global reduction, we also count unpartitioned objects on rank 0.
1081  const auto include_object = [this, &global](const DofObject & dof_object) {
1082  return this->processor_id() == dof_object.processor_id() ||
1083  (global &&
1084  this->processor_id() == 0 &&
1085  dof_object.processor_id() == DofObject::invalid_processor_id);
1086  };
1087 
1088  Real volume = 0;
1089 
1090  // Add bounding box information
1091  const auto bbox = global ? MeshTools::create_bounding_box(*this) : MeshTools::create_local_bounding_box(*this);
1092  if (!global || this->processor_id() == 0)
1093  oss << "\n " << (global ? "" : "Local ") << "Mesh Bounding Box:\n"
1094  << " Minimum: " << bbox.min() << "\n"
1095  << " Maximum: " << bbox.max() << "\n"
1096  << " Delta: " << (bbox.max() - bbox.min()) << "\n";
1097 
1098  // Obtain the global or local element types
1099  std::set<int> elem_types;
1100  for (const Elem * elem : this->active_local_element_ptr_range())
1101  elem_types.insert(elem->type());
1102  if (global)
1103  {
1104  // Pick up unpartitioned elems on rank 0
1105  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
1106  for (const Elem * elem : this->active_unpartitioned_element_ptr_range())
1107  elem_types.insert(elem->type());
1108 
1109  this->comm().set_union(elem_types);
1110  }
1111 
1112  // Add element types
1113  if (!global || this->processor_id() == 0)
1114  oss << "\n " << (global ? "" : "Local ") << "Mesh Element Type(s):\n "
1115  << elem_type_helper(elem_types) << "\n";
1116 
1117  // Reduce the nodeset ids
1118  auto nodeset_ids = this->get_boundary_info().get_node_boundary_ids();
1119  if (global)
1120  this->comm().set_union(nodeset_ids);
1121 
1122  // Accumulate local information for each nodeset
1123  struct NodesetInfo
1124  {
1125  std::size_t num_nodes = 0;
1126  BoundingBox bbox;
1127  };
1128  std::map<boundary_id_type, NodesetInfo> nodeset_info_map;
1129  for (const auto & [node, id] : this->get_boundary_info().get_nodeset_map())
1130  {
1131  if (!include_object(*node))
1132  continue;
1133 
1134  NodesetInfo & info = nodeset_info_map[id];
1135 
1136  ++info.num_nodes;
1137 
1138  if (verbosity > 1)
1139  info.bbox.union_with(*node);
1140  }
1141 
1142  // Add nodeset info
1143  if (!global || this->processor_id() == 0)
1144  {
1145  oss << "\n " << (global ? "" : "Local ") << "Mesh Nodesets:\n";
1146  if (nodeset_ids.empty())
1147  oss << " None\n";
1148  }
1149 
1150  const auto & nodeset_name_map = this->get_boundary_info().get_nodeset_name_map();
1151  for (const auto id : nodeset_ids)
1152  {
1153  NodesetInfo & info = nodeset_info_map[id];
1154 
1155  // Reduce the local information for this nodeset if required
1156  if (global)
1157  {
1158  this->comm().sum(info.num_nodes);
1159  if (verbosity > 1)
1160  {
1161  this->comm().min(info.bbox.min());
1162  this->comm().max(info.bbox.max());
1163  }
1164  }
1165 
1166  const bool has_name = nodeset_name_map.count(id) && nodeset_name_map.at(id).size();
1167  const std::string name = has_name ? nodeset_name_map.at(id) : "";
1168  if (global)
1169  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(name));
1170 
1171  if (global ? this->processor_id() == 0 : info.num_nodes > 0)
1172  {
1173  oss << " Nodeset " << id;
1174  if (has_name)
1175  oss << " (" << name << ")";
1176  oss << ", " << info.num_nodes << " " << (global ? "" : "local ") << "nodes\n";
1177 
1178  if (verbosity > 1)
1179  {
1180  oss << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box minimum: "
1181  << info.bbox.min() << "\n"
1182  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box maximum: "
1183  << info.bbox.max() << "\n"
1184  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box delta: "
1185  << (info.bbox.max() - info.bbox.min()) << "\n";
1186  }
1187  }
1188  }
1189 
1190  // Reduce the sideset ids
1191  auto sideset_ids = this->get_boundary_info().get_side_boundary_ids();
1192  if (global)
1193  this->comm().set_union(sideset_ids);
1194 
1195  // Accumulate local information for each sideset
1196  struct SidesetInfo
1197  {
1198  std::size_t num_sides = 0;
1199  Real volume = 0;
1200  std::set<int> side_elem_types;
1201  std::set<int> elem_types;
1202  std::set<dof_id_type> elem_ids;
1203  std::set<dof_id_type> node_ids;
1204  BoundingBox bbox;
1205  };
1206  ElemSideBuilder side_builder;
1207  std::map<boundary_id_type, SidesetInfo> sideset_info_map;
1208  for (const auto & pair : this->get_boundary_info().get_sideset_map())
1209  {
1210  const Elem * elem = pair.first;
1211  if (!include_object(*elem))
1212  continue;
1213 
1214  const auto id = pair.second.second;
1215  SidesetInfo & info = sideset_info_map[id];
1216 
1217  const auto s = pair.second.first;
1218  const Elem & side = side_builder(*elem, s);
1219 
1220  ++info.num_sides;
1221  info.side_elem_types.insert(side.type());
1222  info.elem_types.insert(elem->type());
1223  info.elem_ids.insert(elem->id());
1224 
1225  for (const Node & node : side.node_ref_range())
1226  if (include_object(node))
1227  info.node_ids.insert(node.id());
1228 
1229  if (verbosity > 1)
1230  {
1231  info.volume += side.volume();
1232  info.bbox.union_with(side.loose_bounding_box());
1233  }
1234  }
1235 
1236  // Add sideset info
1237  if (!global || this->processor_id() == 0)
1238  {
1239  oss << "\n " << (global ? "" : "Local ") << "Mesh Sidesets:\n";
1240  if (sideset_ids.empty())
1241  oss << " None\n";
1242  }
1243  const auto & sideset_name_map = this->get_boundary_info().get_sideset_name_map();
1244  for (const auto id : sideset_ids)
1245  {
1246  SidesetInfo & info = sideset_info_map[id];
1247 
1248  auto num_elems = info.elem_ids.size();
1249  auto num_nodes = info.node_ids.size();
1250 
1251  // Reduce the local information for this sideset if required
1252  if (global)
1253  {
1254  this->comm().sum(info.num_sides);
1255  this->comm().set_union(info.side_elem_types, 0);
1256  this->comm().sum(num_elems);
1257  this->comm().set_union(info.elem_types, 0);
1258  this->comm().sum(num_nodes);
1259  if (verbosity > 1)
1260  {
1261  this->comm().sum(info.volume);
1262  this->comm().min(info.bbox.min());
1263  this->comm().max(info.bbox.max());
1264  }
1265  }
1266 
1267  const bool has_name = sideset_name_map.count(id) && sideset_name_map.at(id).size();
1268  const std::string name = has_name ? sideset_name_map.at(id) : "";
1269  if (global)
1270  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(name));
1271 
1272  if (global ? this->processor_id() == 0 : info.num_sides > 0)
1273  {
1274  oss << " Sideset " << id;
1275  if (has_name)
1276  oss << " (" << name << ")";
1277  oss << ", " << info.num_sides << " sides (" << elem_type_helper(info.side_elem_types) << ")"
1278  << ", " << num_elems << " " << (global ? "" : "local ") << "elems (" << elem_type_helper(info.elem_types) << ")"
1279  << ", " << num_nodes << " " << (global ? "" : "local ") << "nodes\n";
1280 
1281  if (verbosity > 1)
1282  {
1283  oss << " " << (global ? "Side" : "Local side") << " volume: " << info.volume << "\n"
1284  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box minimum: "
1285  << info.bbox.min() << "\n"
1286  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box maximum: "
1287  << info.bbox.max() << "\n"
1288  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box delta: "
1289  << (info.bbox.max() - info.bbox.min()) << "\n";
1290  }
1291  }
1292  }
1293 
1294  // Reduce the edgeset ids
1295  auto edgeset_ids = this->get_boundary_info().get_edge_boundary_ids();
1296  if (global)
1297  this->comm().set_union(edgeset_ids);
1298 
1299  // Accumulate local information for each edgeset
1300  struct EdgesetInfo
1301  {
1302  std::size_t num_edges = 0;
1303  std::set<int> edge_elem_types;
1304  BoundingBox bbox;
1305  };
1306  std::map<boundary_id_type, EdgesetInfo> edgeset_info_map;
1307  std::unique_ptr<const Elem> edge;
1308 
1309  for (const auto & pair : this->get_boundary_info().get_edgeset_map())
1310  {
1311  const Elem * elem = pair.first;
1312  if (!include_object(*elem))
1313  continue;
1314 
1315  const auto id = pair.second.second;
1316  EdgesetInfo & info = edgeset_info_map[id];
1317 
1318  elem->build_edge_ptr(edge, pair.second.first);
1319 
1320  ++info.num_edges;
1321  info.edge_elem_types.insert(edge->type());
1322 
1323  if (verbosity > 1)
1324  info.bbox.union_with(edge->loose_bounding_box());
1325  }
1326 
1327  // Add edgeset info
1328  if (!global || this->processor_id() == 0)
1329  {
1330  oss << "\n " << (global ? "" : "Local ") << "Mesh Edgesets:\n";
1331  if (edgeset_ids.empty())
1332  oss << " None\n";
1333  }
1334 
1335  const auto & edgeset_name_map = this->get_boundary_info().get_edgeset_name_map();
1336  for (const auto id : edgeset_ids)
1337  {
1338  EdgesetInfo & info = edgeset_info_map[id];
1339 
1340  // Reduce the local information for this edgeset if required
1341  if (global)
1342  {
1343  this->comm().sum(info.num_edges);
1344  this->comm().set_union(info.edge_elem_types, 0);
1345  if (verbosity > 1)
1346  {
1347  this->comm().min(info.bbox.min());
1348  this->comm().min(info.bbox.max());
1349  }
1350  }
1351 
1352  const bool has_name = edgeset_name_map.count(id) && edgeset_name_map.at(id).size();
1353  const std::string name = has_name ? edgeset_name_map.at(id) : "";
1354  if (global)
1355  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(name));
1356 
1357  if (global ? this->processor_id() == 0 : info.num_edges > 0)
1358  {
1359  oss << " Edgeset " << id;
1360  if (has_name)
1361  oss << " (" << name << ")";
1362  oss << ", " << info.num_edges << " " << (global ? "" : "local ") << "edges ("
1363  << elem_type_helper(info.edge_elem_types) << ")\n";
1364 
1365  if (verbosity > 1)
1366  {
1367  oss << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box minimum: "
1368  << info.bbox.min() << "\n"
1369  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box maximum: "
1370  << info.bbox.max() << "\n"
1371  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box delta: "
1372  << (info.bbox.max() - info.bbox.min()) << "\n";
1373  }
1374  }
1375  }
1376 
1377  // Reduce the block IDs and block names
1378  std::set<subdomain_id_type> subdomains;
1379  for (const Elem * elem : this->active_element_ptr_range())
1380  if (include_object(*elem))
1381  subdomains.insert(elem->subdomain_id());
1382  if (global)
1383  this->comm().set_union(subdomains);
1384 
1385  // Accumulate local information for each subdomain
1386  struct SubdomainInfo
1387  {
1388  std::size_t num_elems = 0;
1389  Real volume = 0;
1390  std::set<int> elem_types;
1391  std::set<dof_id_type> active_node_ids;
1392 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1393  std::size_t num_active_elems = 0;
1394 #endif
1395  BoundingBox bbox;
1396  };
1397  std::map<subdomain_id_type, SubdomainInfo> subdomain_info_map;
1398  for (const Elem * elem : this->element_ptr_range())
1399  if (include_object(*elem))
1400  {
1401  SubdomainInfo & info = subdomain_info_map[elem->subdomain_id()];
1402 
1403  ++info.num_elems;
1404  info.elem_types.insert(elem->type());
1405 
1406 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1407  if (elem->active())
1408  ++info.num_active_elems;
1409 #endif
1410 
1411  for (const Node & node : elem->node_ref_range())
1412  if (include_object(node) && node.active())
1413  info.active_node_ids.insert(node.id());
1414 
1415  if (verbosity > 1 && elem->active())
1416  {
1417  info.volume += elem->volume();
1418  info.bbox.union_with(elem->loose_bounding_box());
1419  }
1420  }
1421 
1422  // Add subdomain info
1423  oss << "\n " << (global ? "" : "Local ") << "Mesh Subdomains:\n";
1424  const auto & subdomain_name_map = this->get_subdomain_name_map();
1425  for (const auto id : subdomains)
1426  {
1427  SubdomainInfo & info = subdomain_info_map[id];
1428 
1429  auto num_active_nodes = info.active_node_ids.size();
1430 
1431  // Reduce the information for this subdomain if needed
1432  if (global)
1433  {
1434  this->comm().sum(info.num_elems);
1435 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1436  this->comm().sum(info.num_active_elems);
1437 #endif
1438  this->comm().sum(num_active_nodes);
1439  this->comm().set_union(info.elem_types, 0);
1440  if (verbosity > 1)
1441  {
1442  this->comm().min(info.bbox.min());
1443  this->comm().max(info.bbox.max());
1444  this->comm().sum(info.volume);
1445  }
1446  }
1447  if (verbosity > 1)
1448  volume += info.volume;
1449 
1450  const bool has_name = subdomain_name_map.count(id);
1451  const std::string name = has_name ? subdomain_name_map.at(id) : "";
1452  if (global)
1453  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(name));
1454 
1455  if (!global || this->processor_id() == 0)
1456  {
1457  oss << " Subdomain " << id;
1458  if (has_name)
1459  oss << " (" << name << ")";
1460  oss << ": " << info.num_elems << " " << (global ? "" : "local ") << "elems "
1461  << "(" << elem_type_helper(info.elem_types);
1462 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1463  oss << ", " << info.num_active_elems << " active";
1464 #endif
1465  oss << "), " << num_active_nodes << " " << (global ? "" : "local ") << "active nodes\n";
1466  if (verbosity > 1)
1467  {
1468  oss << " " << (global ? "Volume" : "Local volume") << ": " << info.volume << "\n";
1469  oss << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box minimum: "
1470  << info.bbox.min() << "\n"
1471  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box maximum: "
1472  << info.bbox.max() << "\n"
1473  << " " << (global ? "Bounding" : "Local bounding") << " box delta: "
1474  << (info.bbox.max() - info.bbox.min()) << "\n";
1475  }
1476  }
1477  }
1478 
1479  oss << " " << (global ? "Global" : "Local") << " mesh volume = " << volume << "\n";
1480 
1481  }
1482 
1483  return oss.str();
1484 }

inlineinherited
返回
The cached mesh subdomains. As long as the mesh is prepared, this should contain all the subdomain ids across processors. Relies on the mesh being prepared

std::set<GhostingFunctor *>::const_iterator libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_begin ( ) const

virtual Elem* libMesh::MeshBase::insert_elem ( Elem *  e)
pure virtualinherited

Insert elem e to the element array, preserving its id and replacing/deleting any existing element with the same id.

Users should call MeshBase::prepare_for_use() after elements are added to and/or deleted from the mesh.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 all_first_order() , 以及 libMesh::MeshTools::Subdivision::all_subdivision().

virtual Elem* libMesh::MeshBase::insert_elem ( std::unique_ptr< Elem >  e)
pure virtualinherited

Version of insert_elem() taking a std::unique_ptr by value.

The version taking a dumb pointer will eventually be deprecated in favor of this version. This API is intended to indicate that ownership of the Elem is transferred to the Mesh when this function is called, and it should play more nicely with the Elem::build() API which has always returned a std::unique_ptr.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

virtual Node* libMesh::MeshBase::insert_node ( Node *  n)
pure virtualinherited

This method is deprecated.

Please use add_node instead Insert Node n into the Mesh at a location consistent with n->id(), allocating extra storage if necessary. Will error rather than overwriting an existing Node. Only use if you know what you are doing...

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 libMesh::mesh_inserter_iterator< T >::operator=().

virtual Node* libMesh::MeshBase::insert_node ( std::unique_ptr< Node >  n)
pure virtualinherited

This method is deprecated.

Please use add_node instead Version of insert_node() taking a std::unique_ptr by value. This API is intended to indicate that ownership of the Node is transferred to the Mesh when this function is called, and it should play more nicely with the Node::build() API which has always returned a std::unique_ptr.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::libmesh_assert_valid_parallel_ids ( ) const
inlinevirtualinherited

Verify id and processor_id consistency of our elements and nodes containers.

Calls libmesh_assert() on each possible failure. Currently only implemented on DistributedMesh; a serial data structure is much harder to get out of sync.

被 libMesh::DistributedMesh 重载.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1483 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshRefinement::_refine_elements(), libMesh::InfElemBuilder::build_inf_elem() , 以及 libMesh::MeshRefinement::refine_and_coarsen_elements().

1483 {}
bool libMesh::MeshBase::locally_equals ( const MeshBase &  other_mesh) const
inherited

This behaves the same as operator==, but only for the local and ghosted aspects of the mesh; i.e.

operator== is true iff local equality is true on every rank.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 220 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_all_elemset_ids, libMesh::MeshBase::_allow_remote_element_removal, libMesh::MeshBase::_block_id_to_name, libMesh::MeshBase::_constraint_rows, libMesh::MeshBase::_count_lower_dim_elems_in_point_locator, libMesh::MeshBase::_default_ghosting, libMesh::MeshBase::_default_mapping_data, libMesh::MeshBase::_default_mapping_type, libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_dims, libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes, libMesh::MeshBase::_ghosting_functors, libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::MeshBase::_mesh_subdomains, libMesh::MeshBase::_n_parts, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::_partitioner, libMesh::MeshBase::_point_locator_close_to_point_tol, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_all_partitioning, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_find_neighbors, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_noncritical_partitioning, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements, libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension, libMesh::MeshBase::boundary_info, libMesh::MeshBase::get_constraint_rows(), libMesh::index_range(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::query_node_ptr() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::subclass_locally_equals().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::operator==().

221 {
222  // Check whether everything in the base is equal
223  if (_n_parts != other_mesh._n_parts ||
224  _default_mapping_type != other_mesh._default_mapping_type ||
225  _default_mapping_data != other_mesh._default_mapping_data ||
226  _is_prepared != other_mesh._is_prepared ||
227  _count_lower_dim_elems_in_point_locator !=
228  other_mesh._count_lower_dim_elems_in_point_locator ||
229  // We expect this to change in a DistributeMesh prepare_for_use();
230  // it's conceptually "mutable"...
231 /*
232 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
233  _next_unique_id != other_mesh._next_unique_id ||
234 #endif
235 */
236  _skip_noncritical_partitioning != other_mesh._skip_noncritical_partitioning ||
237  _skip_all_partitioning != other_mesh._skip_all_partitioning ||
238  _skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements != other_mesh._skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements ||
239  _skip_find_neighbors != other_mesh._skip_find_neighbors ||
240  _allow_remote_element_removal != other_mesh._allow_remote_element_removal ||
241  _spatial_dimension != other_mesh._spatial_dimension ||
242  _point_locator_close_to_point_tol != other_mesh._point_locator_close_to_point_tol ||
243  _block_id_to_name != other_mesh._block_id_to_name ||
244  _elem_dims != other_mesh._elem_dims ||
245  _mesh_subdomains != other_mesh._mesh_subdomains ||
246  _all_elemset_ids != other_mesh._all_elemset_ids ||
247  _elem_integer_names != other_mesh._elem_integer_names ||
248  _elem_integer_default_values != other_mesh._elem_integer_default_values ||
249  _node_integer_names != other_mesh._node_integer_names ||
250  _node_integer_default_values != other_mesh._node_integer_default_values ||
251  bool(_default_ghosting) != bool(other_mesh._default_ghosting) ||
252  bool(_partitioner) != bool(other_mesh._partitioner) ||
253  *boundary_info != *other_mesh.boundary_info)
254  return false;
255 
256  const constraint_rows_type & other_rows =
257  other_mesh.get_constraint_rows();
258  for (const auto & [node, row] : this->_constraint_rows)
259  {
260  const dof_id_type node_id = node->id();
261  const Node * other_node = other_mesh.query_node_ptr(node_id);
262  if (!other_node)
263  return false;
264 
265  auto it = other_rows.find(other_node);
266  if (it == other_rows.end())
267  return false;
268 
269  const auto & other_row = it->second;
270  if (row.size() != other_row.size())
271  return false;
272 
273  for (auto i : index_range(row))
274  {
275  const auto & [elem_pair, coef] = row[i];
276  const auto & [other_elem_pair, other_coef] = other_row[i];
277  libmesh_assert(elem_pair.first);
278  libmesh_assert(other_elem_pair.first);
279  if (elem_pair.first->id() !=
280  other_elem_pair.first->id() ||
281  elem_pair.second !=
282  other_elem_pair.second ||
283  coef != other_coef)
284  return false;
285  }
286  }
287 
288  for (const auto & [elemset_code, elemset_ptr] : this->_elemset_codes)
289  {
290  auto it = other_mesh._elemset_codes.find(elemset_code);
291  if (it == other_mesh._elemset_codes.end() ||
292  *elemset_ptr != *it->second)
293  return false;
294  }
295 
296  // FIXME: we have no good way to compare ghosting functors, since
297  // they're in a set sorted by pointer, and we have no way *at all*
298  // to compare ghosting functors, since they don't have operator==
299  // defined and we encourage users to subclass them. We can check if
300  // we have the same number, is all.
301  if (_ghosting_functors.size() !=
302  other_mesh._ghosting_functors.size())
303  return false;
304 
305  // Same deal for partitioners. We tested that we both have one or
306  // both don't, but are they equivalent? Let's guess "yes".
307 
308  // Now let the subclasses decide whether everything else is equal
309  return this->subclass_locally_equals(other_mesh);
310 }

std::pair< std::vector< unsigned int >, std::vector< unsigned int > > libMesh::MeshBase::merge_extra_integer_names ( const MeshBase &  other)
protectedinherited

Merge extra-integer arrays from an other mesh.

Returns two mappings from index values in other to (possibly newly created) index values with the same string name in this mesh, the first for element integers and the second for node integers.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1854 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem_integers() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_integers().

参考自 copy_nodes_and_elements() , 以及 create_submesh().

1858  returnval.second = this->add_node_integers(other._node_integer_names, true, &other._node_integer_default_values);
1859  return returnval;

unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension ( ) const
inherited
返回
The logical dimension of the mesh; i.e. the manifold dimension of the elements in the mesh. If we ever support multi-dimensional meshes (e.g. hexes and quads in the same mesh) then this will return the largest such dimension.

virtual dof_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::n_elem ( ) const
pure virtualinherited
返回
The number of elements in the mesh.

The standard n_elem() function may return a cached value on distributed meshes, and so can be called by any processor at any time.

subdomain_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::n_local_subdomains ( ) const
inherited
返回
The number of subdomains in the local mesh. Subdomains correspond to separate subsets of the mesh which could correspond e.g. to different materials in a solid mechanics application, or regions where different physical processes are important. The subdomain mapping is independent from the parallel decomposition.

virtual dof_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::n_nodes ( ) const
pure virtualinherited
返回
The number of nodes in the mesh.

This function and others must be defined in derived classes since the MeshBase class has no specific storage for nodes or elements. The standard n_nodes() function may return a cached value on distributed meshes, and so can be called by any processor at any time.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 all_complete_order(), all_second_order_range(), libMesh::MeshCommunication::assign_global_indices(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_delaunay_square(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_extrusion(), copy_nodes_and_elements(), create_submesh(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::distort(), libMesh::TetGenMeshInterface::fill_pointlist(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_info(), libMesh::VTKIO::get_local_node_values(), libMesh::TreeNode< N >::insert(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::limit_level_mismatch_at_node(), libMesh::VariationalMeshSmoother::metr_data_gen(), libMesh::ErrorVector::plot_error(), libMesh::Nemesis_IO::read(), libMesh::System::read_serialized_vector(), libMesh::System::read_serialized_vectors(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::redistribute(), libMesh::VariationalMeshSmoother::smooth(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::smooth(), libMesh::TreeNode< N >::transform_nodes_to_elements(), libMesh::TriangleInterface::triangulate(), libMesh::TetGenMeshInterface::triangulate_conformingDelaunayMesh_carvehole(), libMesh::Poly2TriTriangulator::triangulate_current_points(), libMesh::FroIO::write(), libMesh::TetGenIO::write(), libMesh::MEDITIO::write_ascii(), libMesh::TecplotIO::write_ascii(), libMesh::GMVIO::write_ascii_new_impl(), libMesh::GMVIO::write_ascii_old_impl(), libMesh::TecplotIO::write_binary(), libMesh::GMVIO::write_binary(), libMesh::UCDIO::write_header(), libMesh::ExodusII_IO::write_nodal_data(), libMesh::GmshIO::write_post(), libMesh::System::write_serialized_vectors(), libMesh::UCDIO::write_soln() , 以及 libMesh::VariationalMeshSmoother::writegr().

libMesh::libmesh_assert

dof_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::n_sub_elem ( ) const
inherited
返回
The number of elements that will be written out in certain I/O formats.

For example, a 9-noded quadrilateral will be broken into 4 linear sub-elements for plotting purposes. Thus, for a mesh of 2 QUAD9 elements n_tecplot_elem() will return 8. Implemented in terms of element_iterators.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 996 行定义.

997 {
998  dof_id_type ne=0;
999 
1000  for (const auto & elem : this->element_ptr_range())
1001  ne += elem->n_sub_elem();
1002 
1003  return ne;
1004 }

subdomain_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::n_subdomains ( ) const
inherited
返回
The number of subdomains in the global mesh. Subdomains correspond to separate subsets of the mesh which could correspond e.g. to different materials in a solid mechanics application, or regions where different physical processes are important. The subdomain mapping is independent from the parallel decomposition.

bool libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_and_elements_equal ( const MeshBase &  other_mesh) const
protectedinherited

Tests for equality of all elements and nodes in the mesh.

Helper function for subclass_equals() in unstructured mesh subclasses.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1899 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::query_elem_ptr() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::query_node_ptr().

1900 {
1901  for (const auto & other_node : other_mesh.node_ptr_range())
1902  {
1903  const Node * node = this->query_node_ptr(other_node->id());
1904  if (!node)
1905  return false;
1906  if (*other_node != *node)
1907  return false;
1908  }
1909  for (const auto & node : this->node_ptr_range())
1910  if (!other_mesh.query_node_ptr(node->id()))
1911  return false;
1912 
1913  for (const auto & other_elem : other_mesh.element_ptr_range())
1914  {
1915  const Elem * elem = this->query_elem_ptr(other_elem->id());
1916  if (!elem)
1917  return false;
1918  if (!other_elem->topologically_equal(*elem))
1919  return false;
1920  }
1921  for (const auto & elem : this->element_ptr_range())
1922  if (!other_mesh.query_elem_ptr(elem->id()))
1923  return false;
1924 
1925  return true;
1926 }

default

Move assignment is allowed, by subclasses who handle post_dofobject_moves()

bool libMesh::MeshBase::operator== ( const MeshBase &  other_mesh) const
inherited

This tests for exactly-equal data in all the senses that a mathematician would care about (element connectivity, nodal coordinates), but in the senses a programmer would care about it allows for non-equal equivalence in some ways (we accept different Elem/Node addresses in memory) but not others (we do not accept different subclass types, nor even different Elem/Node ids).

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 210 行定义.

参考 libMesh::ParallelObject::comm() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::locally_equals().

214  bool is_equal = this->locally_equals(other_mesh);
215  this->comm().min(is_equal);
216  return is_equal;
217 }

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::own_node ( Node &  )
inlinevirtualinherited

Takes ownership of node n on this partition of a distributed mesh, by setting n.processor_id() to this->processor_id(), as well as changing n.id() and moving it in the mesh's internal container to give it a new authoritative id.

被 libMesh::DistributedMesh 重载.

virtual dof_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::parallel_n_elem ( ) const
pure virtualinherited
返回
The number of elements in the mesh.

The parallel_n_elem() function computes a parallel-synchronized value on distributed meshes, and so must be called in parallel only.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 libMesh::Nemesis_IO_Helper::initialize() , 以及 libMesh::Nemesis_IO::read().

virtual dof_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::parallel_n_nodes ( ) const
pure virtualinherited
返回
The number of nodes in the mesh.

This function and others must be overridden in derived classes since the MeshBase class has no specific storage for nodes or elements. The parallel_n_nodes() function computes a parallel-synchronized value on distributed meshes, and so must be called in parallel only.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 libMesh::Nemesis_IO_Helper::initialize() , 以及 libMesh::Nemesis_IO::read().

void libMesh::MeshBase::partition ( const unsigned int  n_parts)
virtualinherited

Call the default partitioner (currently metis_partition()).

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1501 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshTools::correct_node_proc_ids(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_unpartitioned_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::partitioner(), libMesh::MeshBase::recalculate_n_partitions(), libMesh::MeshBase::skip_noncritical_partitioning() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::update_post_partitioning().

参考自 libMesh::split_mesh().

1502 {
1503  // If we get here and we have unpartitioned elements, we need that
1504  // fixed.
1505  if (this->n_unpartitioned_elem() > 0)
1506  {
1507  libmesh_assert (partitioner().get());
1508  libmesh_assert (this->is_serial());
1509  partitioner()->partition (*this, n_parts);
1510  }
1511  // A nullptr partitioner or a skip_partitioning(true) call or a
1512  // skip_noncritical_partitioning(true) call means don't repartition;
1513  // skip_noncritical_partitioning() checks all these.
1514  else if (!skip_noncritical_partitioning())
1515  {
1516  partitioner()->partition (*this, n_parts);
1517  }
1518  else
1519  {
1520  // Adaptive coarsening may have "orphaned" nodes on processors
1521  // whose elements no longer share them. We need to check for
1522  // and possibly fix that.
1523  MeshTools::correct_node_proc_ids(*this);
1524 
1525  // Make sure locally cached partition count is correct
1526  this->recalculate_n_partitions();
1527 
1528  // Make sure any other locally cached data is correct
1529  this->update_post_partitioning();
1530  }
1531 }

void libMesh::MeshBase::post_dofobject_moves ( MeshBase &&  other_mesh)
protectedinherited

Moves any superclass data (e.g.

GhostingFunctors that might rely on element and nodal data (which is managed by subclasses!) being already moved first.

Must be manually called in dofobject-managing subclass move operators.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1865 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_constraint_rows, libMesh::MeshBase::_default_ghosting, libMesh::MeshBase::_ghosting_functors, libMesh::MeshBase::_partitioner , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::_shared_functors.

参考自 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::operator=() , 以及 libMesh::DistributedMesh::operator=().

1866 {
1867  // Now that all the DofObject moving is done, we can move the GhostingFunctor objects
1868  // which include the _default_ghosting,_ghosting_functors and _shared_functors. We also need
1869  // to set the mesh object associated with these functors to the assignee mesh.
1870 
1871  // _default_ghosting
1872  _default_ghosting = std::move(other_mesh._default_ghosting);
1873  _default_ghosting->set_mesh(this);
1874 
1875  // _ghosting_functors
1876  _ghosting_functors = std::move(other_mesh._ghosting_functors);
1877 
1878  for (const auto gf : _ghosting_functors )
1879  {
1880  gf->set_mesh(this);
1881  }
1882 
1883  // _shared_functors
1884  _shared_functors = std::move(other_mesh._shared_functors);
1885 
1886  for (const auto & sf : _shared_functors )
1887  {
1888  (sf.second)->set_mesh(this);
1889  }
1890 
1891  // _constraint_rows
1892  _constraint_rows = std::move(other_mesh._constraint_rows);
1893 
1894  if (other_mesh.partitioner())
1895  _partitioner = std::move(other_mesh.partitioner());
1896 }

libMesh::MeshBase::_default_ghosting
std::unique_ptr< GhostingFunctor > _default_ghosting
The default geometric GhostingFunctor, used to implement standard libMesh element ghosting behavior...
Definition: mesh_base.h:1947
void libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use ( const bool  skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements,
const bool  skip_find_neighbors 
)
inherited

Prepare a newly ecreated (or read) mesh for use.

This involves 4 steps: 1.) call find_neighbors() 2.) call partition() 3.) call renumber_nodes_and_elements() 4.) call cache_elem_data()

The argument to skip renumbering is now deprecated - to prevent a mesh from being renumbered, set allow_renumbering(false). The argument to skip finding neighbors is also deprecated. To prevent find_neighbors, set allow_find_neighbors(false)

If this is a distributed mesh, local copies of remote elements will be deleted here - to keep those elements replicated during preparation, set allow_remote_element_removal(false).

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 708 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::allow_find_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshBase::allow_renumbering() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use().

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::Subdivision::all_subdivision(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::all_tri(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_extrusion(), libMesh::InfElemBuilder::build_inf_elem(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::coarsen_elements(), create_submesh(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::flatten(), libMesh::MeshTools::Subdivision::prepare_subdivision_mesh(), libMesh::GMVIO::read(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::refine_and_coarsen_elements(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::refine_elements(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::sync(), libMesh::TriangleInterface::triangulate(), libMesh::Poly2TriTriangulator::triangulate(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::uniformly_coarsen() , 以及 libMesh::MeshRefinement::uniformly_refine().

709 {
710  libmesh_deprecated();
711 
712  // We only respect the users wish if they tell us to skip renumbering. If they tell us not to
713  // skip renumbering but someone previously called allow_renumbering(false), then the latter takes
714  // precedence
715  if (skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
716  this->allow_renumbering(false);
717 
718  // We always accept the user's value for skip_find_neighbors, in contrast to skip_renumber
719  const bool old_allow_find_neighbors = this->allow_find_neighbors();
720  this->allow_find_neighbors(!skip_find_neighbors);
721 
722  this->prepare_for_use();
723 
724  this->allow_find_neighbors(old_allow_find_neighbors);
725 }

Definition: mesh_base.h:1170

731  // We only respect the users wish if they tell us to skip renumbering. If they tell us not to
732  // skip renumbering but someone previously called allow_renumbering(false), then the latter takes
733  // precedence
734  if (skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)

libMesh::MeshBase::allow_renumbering
bool allow_renumbering() const
Definition: mesh_base.h:1170
void libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use ( )
inherited

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 740 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_allow_remote_element_removal, libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_find_neighbors, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements, libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_data(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear_point_locator(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_remote_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::detect_interior_parents(), libMesh::MeshBase::find_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_boundary_ids(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(), libMesh::MeshBase::partition(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::regenerate_id_sets(), libMesh::MeshBase::reinit_ghosting_functors(), libMesh::MeshBase::remove_orphaned_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::skip_partitioning() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::update_parallel_id_counts().

参考自 all_complete_order(), all_first_order(), all_second_order_range(), copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), read() , 以及 stitching_helper().

741 {
742  LOG_SCOPE("prepare_for_use()", "MeshBase");
743 
744  parallel_object_only();
745 
746  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(this->is_serial()));
747 
748  // A distributed mesh may have processors with no elements (or
749  // processors with no elements of higher dimension, if we ever
750  // support mixed-dimension meshes), but we want consistent
751  // mesh_dimension anyways.
752  //
753  // cache_elem_data() should get the elem_dimensions() and
754  // mesh_dimension() correct later, and we don't need it earlier.
755 
756 
757  // Renumber the nodes and elements so that they in contiguous
758  // blocks. By default, _skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements is false.
759  //
760  // Instances where you if prepare_for_use() should not renumber the nodes
761  // and elements include reading in e.g. an xda/r or gmv file. In
762  // this case, the ordering of the nodes may depend on an accompanying
763  // solution, and the node ordering cannot be changed.
764 
765 
766  // Mesh modification operations might not leave us with consistent
767  // id counts, or might leave us with orphaned nodes we're no longer
768  // using, but our partitioner might need that consistency and/or
769  // might be confused by orphaned nodes.
770  if (!_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
771  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
772  else
773  {
774  this->remove_orphaned_nodes();
775  this->update_parallel_id_counts();
776  }
777 
778  // Let all the elements find their neighbors
779  if (!_skip_find_neighbors)
780  this->find_neighbors();
781 
782  // The user may have set boundary conditions. We require that the
783  // boundary conditions were set consistently. Because we examine
784  // neighbors when evaluating non-raw boundary condition IDs, this
785  // assert is only valid when our neighbor links are in place.
786 #ifdef DEBUG
787  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_boundary_ids(*this);
788 #endif
789 
790  // Search the mesh for all the dimensions of the elements
791  // and cache them.
792  this->cache_elem_data();
793 
794  // Search the mesh for elements that have a neighboring element
795  // of dim+1 and set that element as the interior parent
796  this->detect_interior_parents();
797 
798  // Fix up node unique ids in case mesh generation code didn't take
799  // exceptional care to do so.
800  // MeshCommunication().make_node_unique_ids_parallel_consistent(*this);
801 
802  // We're going to still require that mesh generation code gets
803  // element unique ids consistent.
804 #if defined(DEBUG) && defined(LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID)
805  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(*this);
806 #endif
807 
808  // Reset our PointLocator. Any old locator is invalidated any time
809  // the elements in the underlying elements in the mesh have changed,
810  // so we clear it here.
811  this->clear_point_locator();
812 
813  // Allow our GhostingFunctor objects to reinit if necessary.
814  // Do this before partitioning and redistributing, and before
815  // deleting remote elements.
816  this->reinit_ghosting_functors();
817 
818  // Partition the mesh unless *all* partitioning is to be skipped.
819  // If only noncritical partitioning is to be skipped, the
820  // partition() call will still check for orphaned nodes.
821  if (!skip_partitioning())
822  this->partition();
823 
824  // If we're using DistributedMesh, we'll probably want it
825  // parallelized.
826  if (this->_allow_remote_element_removal)
827  this->delete_remote_elements();
828 
829  // Much of our boundary info may have been for now-remote parts of the mesh,
830  // in which case we don't want to keep local copies of data meant to be
831  // local. On the other hand we may have deleted, or the user may have added in
832  // a distributed fashion, boundary data that is meant to be global. So we
833  // handle both of those scenarios here
834  this->get_boundary_info().regenerate_id_sets();
835 
836  if (!_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
837  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
838 
839  // The mesh is now prepared for use.
840  _is_prepared = true;
841

844 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
845  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(*this);

void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::read ( const std::string &  name,
void *  mesh_data = nullptr,
bool  skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements = false,
bool  skip_find_neighbors = false 
)
overridevirtual

Reads the file specified by name.

Attempts to figure out the proper method by the file extension. This is now the only way to read a mesh. The UnstructuredMesh then initializes its data structures and is ready for use.

The skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements argument is now deprecated - to disallow renumbering, set MeshBase::allow_renumbering(false).

Set skip_find_neighbors=true to skip the find-neighbors operation during prepare_for_use. This operation isn't always necessary and it can be time-consuming, which is why we provide an option to skip it.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 885 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::allow_find_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshBase::allow_renumbering(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use() , 以及 libMesh::NameBasedIO::read().

889 {
890  // Set the skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements flag on all processors
891  // if necessary.
892  // This ensures that renumber_nodes_and_elements is *not* called
893  // during prepare_for_use() for certain types of mesh files.
894  // This is required in cases where there is an associated solution
895  // file which expects a certain ordering of the nodes.
896  if (name.rfind(".gmv") == name.size() - 4)
897  this->allow_renumbering(false);
898 
899  NameBasedIO(*this).read(name);
900 
901  if (skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
902  {
903  // Use MeshBase::allow_renumbering() yourself instead.
904  libmesh_deprecated();
905  this->allow_renumbering(false);
906  }
907 
908  // Done reading the mesh. Now prepare it for use.
909  const bool old_allow_find_neighbors = this->allow_find_neighbors();
910  this->allow_find_neighbors(!skip_find_neighbors);
911  this->prepare_for_use();
912  this->allow_find_neighbors(old_allow_find_neighbors);
913 }

Definition: mesh_base.h:1177
unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::recalculate_n_partitions ( )
inherited

In a few (very rare) cases, the user may have manually tagged the elements with specific processor IDs by hand, without using a partitioner.

In this case, the Mesh will not know that the total number of partitions, _n_parts, has changed, unless you call this function. This is an O(N active elements) calculation. The return value is the number of partitions, and _n_parts is also set by this function.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1538 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_n_parts , 以及 libMesh::ParallelObject::comm().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::partition().

1539 {
1540  // This requires an inspection on every processor
1541  parallel_object_only();
1542 
1543  unsigned int max_proc_id=0;
1544 
1545  for (const auto & elem : this->active_local_element_ptr_range())
1546  max_proc_id = std::max(max_proc_id, static_cast<unsigned int>(elem->processor_id()));
1547 
1548  // The number of partitions is one more than the max processor ID.
1549  _n_parts = max_proc_id+1;
1550 
1551  this->comm().max(_n_parts);
1552 
1553  return _n_parts;
1554 }
libMesh::MeshBase::_n_parts

The number of partitions the mesh has.

void libMesh::MeshBase::redistribute ( )
virtualinherited

Redistribute elements between processors.

This gets called automatically by the Partitioner, and merely notifies any GhostingFunctors of redistribution in the case of a ReplicatedMesh or serialized DistributedMesh

被 libMesh::DistributedMesh 重载.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 923 行定义.

参考 libMesh::as_range(), libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_begin() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_end().

参考自 libMesh::Partitioner::partition(), libMesh::DistributedMesh::redistribute() , 以及 libMesh::Partitioner::single_partition().

924 {
925  // We now have all elements and nodes redistributed; our ghosting
926  // functors should be ready to redistribute and/or recompute any
927  // cached data they use too.
928  for (auto & gf : as_range(this->ghosting_functors_begin(),
929  this->ghosting_functors_end()))
930  gf->redistribute();
931 }

void libMesh::MeshBase::remove_orphaned_nodes ( )
inherited

Removes any orphaned nodes, nodes not connected to any elements.

Typically done automatically in prepare_for_use

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 688 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use().

689 {
690  LOG_SCOPE("remove_orphaned_nodes()", "MeshBase");
691 
692  // Will hold the set of nodes that are currently connected to elements
693  std::unordered_set<Node *> connected_nodes;
694 
695  // Loop over the elements. Find which nodes are connected to at
696  // least one of them.
697  for (const auto & element : this->element_ptr_range())
698  for (auto & n : element->node_ref_range())
699  connected_nodes.insert(&n);
700 
701  for (const auto & node : this->node_ptr_range())
702  if (!connected_nodes.count(node))
703  this->delete_node(node);
704 }
libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node
virtual void delete_node(Node *n)=0
Removes the Node n from the mesh.

)

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements ( )
pure virtualinherited

After partitioning a mesh it is useful to renumber the nodes and elements so that they lie in contiguous blocks on the processors.

This method does just that.

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::reserve_elem ( const dof_id_type  ne)
pure virtualinherited

Reserves space for a known number of elements.

注解
This method may or may not do anything, depending on the actual Mesh implementation. If you know the number of elements you will add and call this method before repeatedly calling add_point() the implementation will be more efficient.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

void libMesh::MeshBase::set_elem_dimensions ( std::set< unsigned char >  elem_dims)
inherited

Most of the time you should not need to call this, as the element dimensions will be set automatically by a call to cache_elem_data(), therefore only call this if you know what you're doing.

In some specialized situations, for example when adding a single Elem on all procs, it can be faster to skip calling cache_elem_data() and simply specify the element dimensions manually, which is why this setter exists.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 331 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_dims , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_data().

332 {
333 #ifdef DEBUG
334  // In debug mode, we call cache_elem_data() and then make sure
335  // the result actually agrees with what the user specified.
336  parallel_object_only();
337 
338  this->cache_elem_data();
339  libmesh_assert_msg(_elem_dims == elem_dims, \
340  "Specified element dimensions does not match true element dimensions!");
341 #endif
342 
343  _elem_dims = std::move(elem_dims);
344 }

void libMesh::MeshBase::set_mesh_dimension ( unsigned char  d)
inlineinherited

Resets the logical dimension of the mesh.

If the mesh has elements of multiple dimensions, this should be set to the largest dimension. E.g. if the mesh has 1D and 2D elements, this should be set to 2. If the mesh has 2D and 3D elements, this should be set to 3.

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::set_next_unique_id ( unique_id_type  id)
pure virtualinherited

Sets the next available unique id to be used.

On a ReplicatedMesh, or when adding unpartitioned objects to a DistributedMesh, this must be kept in sync on all processors.

On a DistributedMesh, other unique_id values (larger than this one) may be chosen next, to allow unique_id assignment without communication.

在 libMesh::DistributedMesh , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh 内被实现.

参考自 all_complete_order(), all_second_order_range(), copy_nodes_and_elements() , 以及 libMesh::Nemesis_IO::read().

void libMesh::MeshBase::set_point_locator_close_to_point_tol ( Real  val)
inherited

Set value used by PointLocatorBase::close_to_point_tol().

Defaults to 0.0. If nonzero, calls close_to_point_tol() whenever a new PointLocator is built for use by this Mesh. Since the Mesh controls the creation and destruction of the PointLocator, if there are any parameters we need to customize on it, the Mesh will need to know about them.
