Definition: mesh_base.h:1921
void libMesh::MeshBase::skip_noncritical_partitioning ( bool  skip)
inlineinherited

If true is passed in then the elements on this mesh will no longer be (re)partitioned, and the nodes on this mesh will only be repartitioned if they are found "orphaned" via coarsening or other removal of the last element responsible for their node/element processor id consistency.

注解
It would probably be a bad idea to call this on a DistributedMesh before the first partitioning has happened... because no elements would get assigned to your processor pool.
Skipping partitioning can have adverse effects on your performance when using AMR... i.e. you could get large load imbalances. However you might still want to use this if the communication and computation of the rebalance and repartition is too high for your application.

It is also possible, for backwards-compatibility purposes, to skip noncritical partitioning by resetting the partitioner() pointer for this mesh.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1209 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_noncritical_partitioning.

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::correct_node_proc_ids().

1210  { _skip_noncritical_partitioning = skip; }
libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_noncritical_partitioning
bool _skip_noncritical_partitioning
If this is true then no partitioning should be done with the possible exception of orphaned nodes...
Definition: mesh_base.h:1821

void libMesh::MeshBase::skip_partitioning ( bool  skip)
inlineinherited

If true is passed in then nothing on this mesh will be (re)partitioned.

注解
The caveats for skip_noncritical_partitioning() still apply, and removing elements from a mesh with this setting enabled can leave node processor ids in an inconsistent state (not matching any attached element), causing failures in other library code. Do not use this setting along with element deletion or coarsening.

Definition: mesh_base.h:1826
unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::spatial_dimension ( ) const
inherited
返回
The "spatial dimension" of the mesh.

The spatial dimension is defined as:

1 - for an exactly x-aligned mesh of 1D elements 2 - for an exactly x-y planar mesh of 2D elements 3 - otherwise

No tolerance checks are performed to determine whether the Mesh is x-aligned or x-y planar, only strict equality with zero in the higher dimensions is checked. Also, x-z and y-z planar meshes are considered to have spatial dimension == 3.

The spatial dimension is updated during prepare_for_use() based on the dimensions of the various elements present in the Mesh, but is never automatically decreased by this function.

For example, if the user calls set_spatial_dimension(2) and then later inserts 3D elements into the mesh, Mesh::spatial_dimension() will return 3 after the next call to prepare_for_use(). On the other hand, if the user calls set_spatial_dimension(3) and then inserts only x-aligned 1D elements into the Mesh, mesh.spatial_dimension() will remain 3.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 493 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::get_info(), libMesh::Nemesis_IO_Helper::initialize() , 以及 libMesh::ExodusII_IO_Helper::initialize().

494 {
495  return cast_int<unsigned int>(_spatial_dimension);
496 }
libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension
unsigned char _spatial_dimension
The &quot;spatial dimension&quot; of the Mesh.
Definition: mesh_base.h:1897
std::size_t libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::stitch_meshes ( const MeshBase &  other_mesh,
boundary_id_type  this_mesh_boundary,
boundary_id_type  other_mesh_boundary,
Real  tol = TOLERANCE,
bool  clear_stitched_boundary_ids = false,
bool  verbose = true,
bool  use_binary_search = true,
bool  enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries = false,
bool  merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing = false,
bool  remap_subdomain_ids = false 
)

Stitch other_mesh to this mesh so that this mesh is the union of the two meshes.

this_mesh_boundary and other_mesh_boundary are used to specify a dim-1 dimensional surface on which we seek to merge any "overlapping" nodes, where we use the parameter tol as a relative tolerance (relative to the smallest edge length on the surfaces being stitched) to determine whether or not nodes are overlapping. If clear_stitched_boundary_ids==true, this function clears boundary_info IDs in this mesh associated this_mesh_boundary and other_mesh_boundary. If use_binary_search is true, we use an optimized "sort then binary search" algorithm for finding matching nodes. Otherwise we use a N^2 algorithm (which can be more reliable at dealing with slightly misaligned meshes). If enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries is true, we throw an error if the number of nodes on the specified boundaries don't match the number of nodes that were merged. This is a helpful error check in some cases. If this is true, it overrides the value of merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing. If skip_find_neighbors is true, a faster stitching method is used, where the lists of neighbors for each elements are copied as well and patched, without calling the time-consuming find_neighbors() function. This option is now hard-coded to true. If merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing is true, instead of throwing an error like enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries, the meshes are combined anyway but coincident nodes are not merged into single nodes. This is useful in cases where you are not sure if the boundaries are fully conforming beforehand and you want to handle the non-conforming cases differently.

Note that the element IDs for elements in the stitched mesh corresponding to "this" mesh will be unchanged. The IDs for elements corresponding to other_mesh will be incremented by this->max_elem_id().

There is no simple a priori relationship between node IDs in "this" mesh and other_mesh and node IDs in the stitched mesh because the number of nodes (and hence the node IDs) in the stitched mesh depend on how many nodes are stitched.

If remap_subdomain_ids is true then we assume that some subdomain ids might have been autogenerated, so we remap them as necessary, treating subdomain names as the important thing for consistency; if we have missing names and cannot infer a consistent resolution to an id conflict then we exit with an error. If remap_subdomain_ids is false then we revert to the older libMesh behavior: leave all subdomain ids alone and woe unto you if you weren't keeping track of them.

返回
the count of how many nodes were merged between the two meshes. This can be zero in the case of no matching nodes or if merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing was active and relevant.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 1734 行定义.

参考 stitching_helper().

1744 {
1745  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes()", "UnstructuredMesh");
1746  return stitching_helper(&other_mesh,
1747  this_mesh_boundary_id,
1748  other_mesh_boundary_id,
1749  tol,
1750  clear_stitched_boundary_ids,
1751  verbose,
1752  use_binary_search,
1753  enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries,
1754  true,
1755  merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing,
1756  remap_subdomain_ids);
1757 }

Helper function for stitch_meshes and stitch_surfaces that does the mesh stitching.
Definition: unstructured_mesh.C:1786

Similar to stitch_meshes, except that we stitch two adjacent surfaces within this mesh.

Definition: unstructured_mesh.C:1786
std::size_t libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::stitching_helper ( const MeshBase *  other_mesh,
boundary_id_type  boundary_id_1,
boundary_id_type  boundary_id_2,
Real  tol,
bool  clear_stitched_boundary_ids,
bool  verbose,
bool  use_binary_search,
bool  enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries,
bool  skip_find_neighbors,
bool  merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing,
bool  remap_subdomain_ids 
)
private

Helper function for stitch_meshes and stitch_surfaces that does the mesh stitching.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 1786 行定义.

参考 libMesh::BoundaryInfo::add_edge(), libMesh::MeshBase::add_elemset_code(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::add_node(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::add_shellface(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::add_side(), libMesh::MeshBase::allow_find_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshBase::allow_remote_element_removal(), libMesh::Utility::binary_find(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::boundary_ids(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::build_edge_list(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::build_node_list(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::build_shellface_list(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::build_side_list(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::clear_stitched_boundary_side_ids(), copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node(), libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::edge_boundary_ids(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_edgeset_name_map(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemset_codes(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemsets(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_nodeset_name_map(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_sideset_name(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::get_sideset_name_map(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_subdomain_name_map(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::invalid_id, libMesh::invalid_uint, libMesh::Elem::key(), libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_neighbors(), libMesh::Elem::local_node(), libMesh::MeshBase::max_elem_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::max_node_id(), mesh, libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::node_ref(), std::norm(), libMesh::out, libMesh::MeshBase::parallel_max_unique_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::point(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::BoundaryInfo::set_edgeset_name_map(), libMesh::Elem::set_neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::set_node(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::set_nodeset_name_map(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::set_sideset_name_map(), libMesh::Elem::side_index_range(), libMesh::Elem::side_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::subactive(), libMesh::MeshBase::subdomain_name() , 以及 libMesh::TOLERANCE.

参考自 stitch_meshes() , 以及 stitch_surfaces().

1797 {
1798 #ifdef DEBUG
1799  // We rely on neighbor links here
1800  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_neighbors(*this);
1801 #endif
1802 
1803  // FIXME: make distributed mesh support efficient.
1804  // Yes, we currently suck.
1805  MeshSerializer serialize(*this);
1806 
1807  // *Badly*.
1808  std::unique_ptr<MeshSerializer> serialize_other;
1809  if (other_mesh)
1810  serialize_other = std::make_unique<MeshSerializer>
1811  (*const_cast<MeshBase *>(other_mesh));
1812 
1813  std::map<dof_id_type, dof_id_type> node_to_node_map, other_to_this_node_map; // The second is the inverse map of the first
1814  std::map<dof_id_type, std::vector<dof_id_type>> node_to_elems_map;
1815 
1816  typedef dof_id_type key_type;
1817  typedef std::pair<const Elem *, unsigned char> val_type;
1818  typedef std::pair<key_type, val_type> key_val_pair;
1819  typedef std::unordered_multimap<key_type, val_type> map_type;
1820  // Mapping between all side keys in this mesh and elements+side numbers relevant to the boundary in this mesh as well.
1821  map_type side_to_elem_map;
1822 
1823  // If there is only one mesh (i.e. other_mesh == nullptr), then loop over this mesh twice
1824  if (!other_mesh)
1825  {
1826  other_mesh = this;
1827  }
1828 
1829  if ((this_mesh_boundary_id != BoundaryInfo::invalid_id) &&
1830  (other_mesh_boundary_id != BoundaryInfo::invalid_id))
1831  {
1832  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes node merging", "UnstructuredMesh");
1833 
1834  // While finding nodes on the boundary, also find the minimum edge length
1835  // of all faces on both boundaries. This will later be used in relative
1836  // distance checks when stitching nodes.
1837  Real h_min = std::numeric_limits<Real>::max();
1838  bool h_min_updated = false;
1839 
1840  // Loop below fills in these sets for the two meshes.
1841  std::set<dof_id_type> this_boundary_node_ids, other_boundary_node_ids;
1842 
1843  // Pull objects out of the loop to reduce heap operations
1844  std::unique_ptr<const Elem> side;
1845 
1846  {
1847  // Make temporary fixed-size arrays for loop
1848  boundary_id_type id_array[2] = {this_mesh_boundary_id, other_mesh_boundary_id};
1849  std::set<dof_id_type> * set_array[2] = {&this_boundary_node_ids, &other_boundary_node_ids};
1850  const MeshBase * mesh_array[2] = {this, other_mesh};
1851 
1852  for (unsigned i=0; i<2; ++i)
1853  {
1854  // First we deal with node boundary IDs.
1855  // We only enter this loop if we have at least one
1856  // nodeset.
1857  if (mesh_array[i]->get_boundary_info().n_nodeset_conds() > 0)
1858  {
1859  // build_node_list() returns a vector of (node-id, bc-id) tuples
1860  for (const auto & t : mesh_array[i]->get_boundary_info().build_node_list())
1861  {
1862  boundary_id_type node_bc_id = std::get<1>(t);
1863  if (node_bc_id == id_array[i])
1864  {
1865  dof_id_type this_node_id = std::get<0>(t);
1866  set_array[i]->insert( this_node_id );
1867 
1868  // We need to set h_min to some value. It's too expensive to
1869  // search for the element that actually contains this node,
1870  // since that would require a PointLocator. As a result, we
1871  // just use the first (non-NodeElem!) element in the mesh to
1872  // give us hmin if it's never been set before.
1873  if (!h_min_updated)
1874  {
1875  for (const auto & elem : mesh_array[i]->active_element_ptr_range())
1876  {
1877  Real current_h_min = elem->hmin();
1878  if (current_h_min > 0.)
1879  {
1880  h_min = current_h_min;
1881  h_min_updated = true;
1882  break;
1883  }
1884  }
1885 
1886  // If, after searching all the active elements, we did not update
1887  // h_min, give up and set h_min to 1 so that we don't repeat this
1888  // fruitless search
1889  if (!h_min_updated)
1890  {
1891  h_min_updated = true;
1892  h_min = 1.0;
1893  }
1894  }
1895  }
1896  }
1897  }
1898 
1899  // Container to catch boundary IDs passed back from BoundaryInfo.
1900  std::vector<boundary_id_type> bc_ids;
1901 
1902  for (auto & el : mesh_array[i]->element_ptr_range())
1903  {
1904  // Now check whether elem has a face on the specified boundary
1905  for (auto side_id : el->side_index_range())
1906  if (el->neighbor_ptr(side_id) == nullptr)
1907  {
1908  // Get *all* boundary IDs on this side, not just the first one!
1909  mesh_array[i]->get_boundary_info().boundary_ids (el, side_id, bc_ids);
1910 
1911  if (std::find(bc_ids.begin(), bc_ids.end(), id_array[i]) != bc_ids.end())
1912  {
1913  el->build_side_ptr(side, side_id);
1914  for (auto & n : side->node_ref_range())
1915  set_array[i]->insert(n.id());
1916 
1917  h_min = std::min(h_min, side->hmin());
1918  h_min_updated = true;
1919 
1920  // This side is on the boundary, add its information to side_to_elem
1921  if (skip_find_neighbors && (i==0))
1922  {
1923  key_type key = el->key(side_id);
1924  val_type val;
1925  val.first = el;
1926  val.second = cast_int<unsigned char>(side_id);
1927 
1928  key_val_pair kvp;
1929  kvp.first = key;
1930  kvp.second = val;
1931  side_to_elem_map.insert (kvp);
1932  }
1933  }
1934 
1935  // Also, check the edges on this side. We don't have to worry about
1936  // updating neighbor info in this case since elements don't store
1937  // neighbor info on edges.
1938  for (auto edge_id : el->edge_index_range())
1939  {
1940  if (el->is_edge_on_side(edge_id, side_id))
1941  {
1942  // Get *all* boundary IDs on this edge, not just the first one!
1943  mesh_array[i]->get_boundary_info().edge_boundary_ids (el, edge_id, bc_ids);
1944 
1945  if (std::find(bc_ids.begin(), bc_ids.end(), id_array[i]) != bc_ids.end())
1946  {
1947  std::unique_ptr<const Elem> edge (el->build_edge_ptr(edge_id));
1948  for (auto & n : edge->node_ref_range())
1949  set_array[i]->insert( n.id() );
1950 
1951  h_min = std::min(h_min, edge->hmin());
1952  h_min_updated = true;
1953  }
1954  }
1955  }
1956  }
1957  }
1958  }
1959  }
1960 
1961  if (verbose)
1962  {
1963  libMesh::out << "In UnstructuredMesh::stitch_meshes:\n"
1964  << "This mesh has " << this_boundary_node_ids.size()
1965  << " nodes on boundary `"
1966  << this->get_boundary_info().get_sideset_name(this_mesh_boundary_id)
1967  << "' (" << this_mesh_boundary_id << ").\n"
1968  << "Other mesh has " << other_boundary_node_ids.size()
1969  << " nodes on boundary `"
1970  << this->get_boundary_info().get_sideset_name(other_mesh_boundary_id)
1971  << "' (" << other_mesh_boundary_id << ").\n";
1972 
1973  if (h_min_updated)
1974  {
1975  libMesh::out << "Minimum edge length on both surfaces is " << h_min << ".\n";
1976  }
1977  else
1978  {
1979  libMesh::out << "No elements on specified surfaces." << std::endl;
1980  }
1981  }
1982 
1983  // At this point, if h_min==0 it means that there were at least two coincident
1984  // nodes on the surfaces being stitched, and we don't currently support that case.
1985  // (It might be possible to support, but getting it exactly right would be tricky
1986  // and probably not worth the extra complications to the "normal" case.)
1987  libmesh_error_msg_if(h_min < std::numeric_limits<Real>::epsilon(),
1988  "Coincident nodes detected on source and/or target "
1989  "surface, stitching meshes is not possible.");
1990 
1991  // We require nanoflann for the "binary search" (really kd-tree)
1992  // option to work. If it's not available, turn that option off,
1993  // warn the user, and fall back on the N^2 search algorithm.
1994  if (use_binary_search)
1995  {
1996 #ifndef LIBMESH_HAVE_NANOFLANN
1997  use_binary_search = false;
1998  libmesh_warning("The use_binary_search option in the "
1999  "UnstructuredMesh stitching algorithms requires nanoflann "
2000  "support. Falling back on N^2 search algorithm.");
2001 #endif
2002  }
2003 
2004  if (this_boundary_node_ids.size())
2005  {
2006  if (use_binary_search)
2007  {
2008 #ifdef LIBMESH_HAVE_NANOFLANN
2009  typedef nanoflann::KDTreeSingleIndexAdaptor<nanoflann::L2_Simple_Adaptor<Real, VectorOfNodesAdaptor>,
2010  VectorOfNodesAdaptor, 3, std::size_t> kd_tree_t;
2011 
2012  // Create the dataset needed to build the kd tree with nanoflann
2013  std::vector<std::pair<Point, dof_id_type>> this_mesh_nodes(this_boundary_node_ids.size());
2014  std::set<dof_id_type>::iterator current_node = this_boundary_node_ids.begin(),
2015  node_ids_end = this_boundary_node_ids.end();
2016  for (unsigned int ctr = 0; current_node != node_ids_end; ++current_node, ++ctr)
2017  {
2018  this_mesh_nodes[ctr].first = this->point(*current_node);
2019  this_mesh_nodes[ctr].second = *current_node;
2020  }
2021 
2022  VectorOfNodesAdaptor vec_nodes_adaptor(this_mesh_nodes);
2023 
2024  kd_tree_t this_kd_tree(3, vec_nodes_adaptor, 10);
2025  this_kd_tree.buildIndex();
2026 
2027  // Storage for nearest neighbor in the loop below
2028  std::size_t ret_index;
2029  Real ret_dist_sqr;
2030 
2031  // Loop over other mesh. For each node, find its nearest neighbor in this mesh, and fill in the maps.
2032  for (auto node : other_boundary_node_ids)
2033  {
2034  const Real query_pt[] = {other_mesh->point(node)(0), other_mesh->point(node)(1), other_mesh->point(node)(2)};
2035  this_kd_tree.knnSearch(&query_pt[0], 1, &ret_index, &ret_dist_sqr);
2036  if (ret_dist_sqr < TOLERANCE*TOLERANCE)
2037  {
2038  node_to_node_map[this_mesh_nodes[ret_index].second] = node;
2039  other_to_this_node_map[node] = this_mesh_nodes[ret_index].second;
2040  }
2041  }
2042 
2043  // If the 2 maps don't have the same size, it means we have overwritten a value in node_to_node_map
2044  // It means one node in this mesh is the nearest neighbor of several nodes in other mesh.
2045  // Not possible !
2046  libmesh_error_msg_if(node_to_node_map.size() != other_to_this_node_map.size(),
2047  "Error: Found multiple matching nodes in stitch_meshes");
2048 #endif
2049  }
2050  else
2051  {
2052  // In the unlikely event that two meshes composed entirely of
2053  // NodeElems are being stitched together, we will not have
2054  // selected a valid h_min value yet, and the distance
2055  // comparison below will be true for essentially any two
2056  // nodes. In this case we simply fall back on an absolute
2057  // distance check.
2058  if (!h_min_updated)
2059  {
2060  libmesh_warning("No valid h_min value was found, falling back on "
2061  "absolute distance check in the N^2 search algorithm.");
2062  h_min = 1.;
2063  }
2064 
2065  // Otherwise, use a simple N^2 search to find the closest matching points. This can be helpful
2066  // in the case that we have tolerance issues which cause mismatch between the two surfaces
2067  // that are being stitched.
2068  for (const auto & this_node_id : this_boundary_node_ids)
2069  {
2070  Node & this_node = this->node_ref(this_node_id);
2071 
2072  bool found_matching_nodes = false;
2073 
2074  for (const auto & other_node_id : other_boundary_node_ids)
2075  {
2076  const Node & other_node = other_mesh->node_ref(other_node_id);
2077 
2078  Real node_distance = (this_node - other_node).norm();
2079 
2080  if (node_distance < tol*h_min)
2081  {
2082  // Make sure we didn't already find a matching node!
2083  libmesh_error_msg_if(found_matching_nodes,
2084  "Error: Found multiple matching nodes in stitch_meshes");
2085 
2086  node_to_node_map[this_node_id] = other_node_id;
2087  other_to_this_node_map[other_node_id] = this_node_id;
2088 
2089  found_matching_nodes = true;
2090  }
2091  }
2092  }
2093  }
2094  }
2095 
2096  // Build up the node_to_elems_map, using only one loop over other_mesh
2097  for (auto & el : other_mesh->element_ptr_range())
2098  {
2099  // For each node on the element, find the corresponding node
2100  // on "this" Mesh, 'this_node_id', if it exists, and push
2101  // the current element ID back onto node_to_elems_map[this_node_id].
2102  // For that we will use the reverse mapping we created at
2103  // the same time as the forward mapping.
2104  for (auto & n : el->node_ref_range())
2105  {
2106  dof_id_type other_node_id = n.id();
2107  std::map<dof_id_type, dof_id_type>::iterator it =
2108  other_to_this_node_map.find(other_node_id);
2109 
2110  if (it != other_to_this_node_map.end())
2111  {
2112  dof_id_type this_node_id = it->second;
2113  node_to_elems_map[this_node_id].push_back( el->id() );
2114  }
2115  }
2116  }
2117 
2118  if (verbose)
2119  {
2120  libMesh::out << "In UnstructuredMesh::stitch_meshes:\n"
2121  << "Found " << node_to_node_map.size()
2122  << " matching nodes.\n"
2123  << std::endl;
2124  }
2125 
2126  if (enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries)
2127  {
2128  std::size_t n_matching_nodes = node_to_node_map.size();
2129  std::size_t this_mesh_n_nodes = this_boundary_node_ids.size();
2130  std::size_t other_mesh_n_nodes = other_boundary_node_ids.size();
2131  libmesh_error_msg_if((n_matching_nodes != this_mesh_n_nodes) || (n_matching_nodes != other_mesh_n_nodes),
2132  "Error: We expected the number of nodes to match.");
2133  }
2134 
2135  if (merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing)
2136  {
2137  std::size_t n_matching_nodes = node_to_node_map.size();
2138  std::size_t this_mesh_n_nodes = this_boundary_node_ids.size();
2139  std::size_t other_mesh_n_nodes = other_boundary_node_ids.size();
2140  if ((n_matching_nodes != this_mesh_n_nodes) || (n_matching_nodes != other_mesh_n_nodes))
2141  {
2142  if (verbose)
2143  {
2144  libMesh::out << "Skipping node merging in "
2145  "UnstructuredMesh::stitch_meshes because not "
2146  "all boundary nodes were matched."
2147  << std::endl;
2148  }
2149  node_to_node_map.clear();
2150  other_to_this_node_map.clear();
2151  node_to_elems_map.clear();
2152  }
2153  }
2154  }
2155  else
2156  {
2157  if (verbose)
2158  {
2159  libMesh::out << "Skip node merging in UnstructuredMesh::stitch_meshes:" << std::endl;
2160  }
2161  }
2162 
2163  dof_id_type node_delta = this->max_node_id();
2164  dof_id_type elem_delta = this->max_elem_id();
2165 
2166  unique_id_type unique_delta =
2167 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
2168  this->parallel_max_unique_id();
2169 #else
2170  0;
2171 #endif
2172 
2173  // If other_mesh != nullptr, then we have to do a bunch of work
2174  // in order to copy it to this mesh
2175  if (this!=other_mesh)
2176  {
2177  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes copying", "UnstructuredMesh");
2178 
2179  // Increment the node_to_node_map and node_to_elems_map
2180  // to account for id offsets
2181  for (auto & pr : node_to_node_map)
2182  pr.second += node_delta;
2183 
2184  for (auto & pr : node_to_elems_map)
2185  for (auto & entry : pr.second)
2186  entry += elem_delta;
2187 
2188  // We run into problems when the libMesh subdomain standard (the
2189  // id defines the subdomain; the name was an afterthought) and
2190  // the MOOSE standard (the name defines the subdomain; the id
2191  // might be autogenerated) clash.
2192  //
2193  // Subdomain ids with the same name in both meshes are surely
2194  // meant to represent the same subdomain. We can just merge
2195  // them.
2196  //
2197  // Subdomain ids which don't have a name in either mesh are
2198  // almost surely meant to represent the same subdomain. We'll
2199  // just merge them.
2200  //
2201  // Subdomain ids with different names in different meshes, or
2202  // names with different ids in different meshes, are trickier.
2203  // For backwards compatibility we default to the old "just copy
2204  // all the subdomain ids over" behavior, but if requested we'll
2205  // remap any ids that appear to be clear conflicts, and we'll
2206  // scream and die if we see any ids that are ambiguous due to
2207  // being named in one mesh but not the other.
2208  std::unordered_map<subdomain_id_type, subdomain_id_type> id_remapping;
2209  if (remap_subdomain_ids)
2210  {
2211  const auto & this_map = this->get_subdomain_name_map();
2212  const auto & other_map = other_mesh->get_subdomain_name_map();
2213  std::unordered_map<std::string, subdomain_id_type> other_map_reversed;
2214  for (auto & [sid, sname] : other_map)
2215  other_map_reversed.emplace(sname, sid);
2216 
2217  std::unordered_map<std::string, subdomain_id_type> this_map_reversed;
2218  for (auto & [sid, sname] : this_map)
2219  this_map_reversed.emplace(sname, sid);
2220 
2221  // We don't require either mesh to be prepared, but that
2222  // means we need to check for subdomains manually.
2223  auto get_subdomains = [](const MeshBase & mesh) {
2224  std::set<subdomain_id_type> all_subdomains;
2225  for (auto & el : mesh.element_ptr_range())
2226  all_subdomains.insert(el->subdomain_id());
2227  return all_subdomains;
2228  };
2229 
2230  const auto this_subdomains = get_subdomains(*this);
2231  const auto other_subdomains = get_subdomains(*other_mesh);
2232 
2233  for (auto & [sid, sname] : this_map)
2234  {
2235  auto other_reverse_it = other_map_reversed.find(sname);
2236 
2237  // The same name with the same id means we're fine. The
2238  // same name with another id means we remap their id to
2239  // ours
2240  if (other_reverse_it != other_map_reversed.end())
2241  {
2242  if (other_reverse_it->second != sid)
2243  id_remapping[other_reverse_it->second] = sid;
2244  }
2245 
2246  // The same id with a different name, we'll get to
2247  // later. The same id without any name means we don't
2248  // know what the user wants.
2249  if (other_subdomains.count(sid) && !other_map.count(sid))
2250  libmesh_error_msg("Can't safely stitch with a mesh sharing subdomain id "
2251  << sid << " but not subdomain name " << sname);
2252  }
2253 
2254  subdomain_id_type next_free_id = 0;
2255  // We might try to stitch empty meshes ...
2256  if (!this_subdomains.empty())
2257  next_free_id = *this_subdomains.rbegin() + 1;
2258  if (!other_subdomains.empty())
2259  next_free_id =
2260  std::max(next_free_id,
2261  cast_int<subdomain_id_type>
2262  (*other_subdomains.rbegin() + 1));
2263 
2264  for (auto & [sid, sname] : other_map)
2265  {
2266  auto reverse_it = this_map_reversed.find(sname);
2267 
2268  // At this point we've figured out any remapping
2269  // necessary for an sname that we share. And we don't
2270  // need to remap any sid we don't share.
2271  if (reverse_it == this_map_reversed.end())
2272  {
2273  // But if we don't have this sname and we do have this
2274  // sid then we can't just merge into that.
2275  if (this_subdomains.count(sid))
2276  {
2277  // If we have this sid with no name, we don't
2278  // know what the user wants.
2279  if (!this_map.count(sid))
2280  libmesh_error_msg("Can't safely stitch with a mesh sharing subdomain id "
2281  << sid << " but under subdomain name " << sname);
2282 
2283  // We have this sid under a different name, so
2284  // we just need to give the other elements a new
2285  // id.
2286 
2287  // Users might have done crazy things with id
2288  // choice so let's make sure they didn't get too
2289  // crazy.
2290  libmesh_error_msg_if ((!this_subdomains.empty() &&
2291  next_free_id < *this_subdomains.rbegin()) ||
2292  (!other_subdomains.empty() &&
2293  next_free_id < *other_subdomains.rbegin()),
2294  "Subdomain id overflow");
2295 
2296  id_remapping[sid] = next_free_id++;
2297  this->subdomain_name(next_free_id) = sname;
2298  }
2299  // If we don't have this subdomain id, well, we're
2300  // about to, so we should have its name too.
2301  else
2302  this->subdomain_name(sid) = sname;
2303  }
2304  }
2305  }
2306 
2307  // Copy mesh data. If we skip the call to find_neighbors(), the lists
2308  // of neighbors will be copied verbatim from the other mesh
2309  this->copy_nodes_and_elements(*other_mesh, skip_find_neighbors,
2310  elem_delta, node_delta,
2311  unique_delta, &id_remapping);
2312 
2313  // Copy BoundaryInfo from other_mesh too. We do this via the
2314  // list APIs rather than element-by-element for speed.
2315  BoundaryInfo & boundary = this->get_boundary_info();
2316  const BoundaryInfo & other_boundary = other_mesh->get_boundary_info();
2317 
2318  for (const auto & t : other_boundary.build_node_list())
2319  boundary.add_node(std::get<0>(t) + node_delta,
2320  std::get<1>(t));
2321 
2322  for (const auto & t : other_boundary.build_side_list())
2323  boundary.add_side(std::get<0>(t) + elem_delta,
2324  std::get<1>(t),
2325  std::get<2>(t));
2326 
2327  for (const auto & t : other_boundary.build_edge_list())
2328  boundary.add_edge(std::get<0>(t) + elem_delta,
2329  std::get<1>(t),
2330  std::get<2>(t));
2331 
2332  for (const auto & t : other_boundary.build_shellface_list())
2333  boundary.add_shellface(std::get<0>(t) + elem_delta,
2334  std::get<1>(t),
2335  std::get<2>(t));
2336 
2337  const auto & other_ns_id_to_name = other_boundary.get_nodeset_name_map();
2338  auto & ns_id_to_name = boundary.set_nodeset_name_map();
2339  ns_id_to_name.insert(other_ns_id_to_name.begin(), other_ns_id_to_name.end());
2340 
2341  const auto & other_ss_id_to_name = other_boundary.get_sideset_name_map();
2342  auto & ss_id_to_name = boundary.set_sideset_name_map();
2343  ss_id_to_name.insert(other_ss_id_to_name.begin(), other_ss_id_to_name.end());
2344 
2345  const auto & other_es_id_to_name = other_boundary.get_edgeset_name_map();
2346  auto & es_id_to_name = boundary.set_edgeset_name_map();
2347  es_id_to_name.insert(other_es_id_to_name.begin(), other_es_id_to_name.end());
2348 
2349  // Merge other_mesh's elemset information with ours. Throw an
2350  // error if this and other_mesh have overlapping elemset codes
2351  // that refer to different elemset ids.
2352  std::vector<dof_id_type> this_elemset_codes = this->get_elemset_codes();
2353  MeshBase::elemset_type this_id_set_to_fill, other_id_set_to_fill;
2354  for (const auto & elemset_code : other_mesh->get_elemset_codes())
2355  {
2356  // Get the elemset ids for this elemset_code on other_mesh
2357  other_mesh->get_elemsets(elemset_code, other_id_set_to_fill);
2358 
2359  // Check that this elemset code does not already exist
2360  // in this mesh, or if it does, that it has the same elemset
2361  // ids associated with it.
2362  //
2363  // Note: get_elemset_codes() is guaranteed to return a
2364  // sorted vector, so we can binary search in it.
2365  auto it = Utility::binary_find(this_elemset_codes.begin(),
2366  this_elemset_codes.end(),
2367  elemset_code);
2368 
2369  if (it != this_elemset_codes.end())
2370  {
2371  // This mesh has the same elemset code. Does it refer to
2372  // the same elemset ids?
2373  this->get_elemsets(elemset_code, this_id_set_to_fill);
2374 
2375  // Throw an error if they don't match, otherwise we
2376  // don't need to do anything
2377  libmesh_error_msg_if(other_id_set_to_fill != this_id_set_to_fill,
2378  "Attempted to stitch together meshes with conflicting elemset codes.");
2379  }
2380  else
2381  {
2382  // Add other_mesh's elemset code to this mesh
2383  this->add_elemset_code(elemset_code, other_id_set_to_fill);
2384  }
2385  }
2386  } // end if (other_mesh)
2387 
2388  // Finally, we need to "merge" the overlapping nodes
2389  // We do this by iterating over node_to_elems_map and updating
2390  // the elements so that they "point" to the nodes that came
2391  // from this mesh, rather than from other_mesh.
2392  // Then we iterate over node_to_node_map and delete the
2393  // duplicate nodes that came from other_mesh.
2394 
2395  {
2396  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes node updates", "UnstructuredMesh");
2397 
2398  // Container to catch boundary IDs passed back from BoundaryInfo.
2399  std::vector<boundary_id_type> bc_ids;
2400 
2401  for (const auto & [target_node_id, elem_vec] : node_to_elems_map)
2402  {
2403  dof_id_type other_node_id = node_to_node_map[target_node_id];
2404  Node & target_node = this->node_ref(target_node_id);
2405 
2406  std::size_t n_elems = elem_vec.size();
2407  for (std::size_t i=0; i<n_elems; i++)
2408  {
2409  dof_id_type elem_id = elem_vec[i];
2410  Elem * el = this->elem_ptr(elem_id);
2411 
2412  // find the local node index that we want to update
2413  unsigned int local_node_index = el->local_node(other_node_id);
2414  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to(local_node_index, libMesh::invalid_uint);
2415 
2416  // We also need to copy over the nodeset info here,
2417  // because the node will get deleted below
2418  this->get_boundary_info().boundary_ids(el->node_ptr(local_node_index), bc_ids);
2419  el->set_node(local_node_index) = &target_node;
2420  this->get_boundary_info().add_node(&target_node, bc_ids);
2421  }
2422  }
2423  }
2424 
2425  {
2426  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes node deletion", "UnstructuredMesh");
2427  for (const auto & [other_node_id, this_node_id] : node_to_node_map)
2428  {
2429  // In the case that this==other_mesh, the two nodes might be the same (e.g. if
2430  // we're stitching a "sliver"), hence we need to skip node deletion in that case.
2431  if ((this == other_mesh) && (this_node_id == other_node_id))
2432  continue;
2433 
2434  this->delete_node( this->node_ptr(this_node_id) );
2435  }
2436  }
2437 
2438  // If find_neighbors() wasn't called in prepare_for_use(), we need to
2439  // manually loop once more over all elements adjacent to the stitched boundary
2440  // and fix their lists of neighbors.
2441  // This is done according to the following steps:
2442  // 1. Loop over all copied elements adjacent to the boundary using node_to_elems_map (trying to avoid duplicates)
2443  // 2. Look at all their sides with a nullptr neighbor and update them using side_to_elem_map if necessary
2444  // 3. Update the corresponding side in side_to_elem_map as well
2445  if (skip_find_neighbors)
2446  {
2447  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes neighbor fixes", "UnstructuredMesh");
2448 
2449  // Pull objects out of the loop to reduce heap operations
2450  std::unique_ptr<const Elem> my_side, their_side;
2451 
2452  std::set<dof_id_type> fixed_elems;
2453  for (const auto & pr : node_to_elems_map)
2454  {
2455  std::size_t n_elems = pr.second.size();
2456  for (std::size_t i=0; i<n_elems; i++)
2457  {
2458  dof_id_type elem_id = pr.second[i];
2459  if (fixed_elems.find(elem_id) == fixed_elems.end())
2460  {
2461  Elem * el = this->elem_ptr(elem_id);
2462  fixed_elems.insert(elem_id);
2463  for (auto s : el->side_index_range())
2464  {
2465  if (el->neighbor_ptr(s) == nullptr)
2466  {
2467  key_type key = el->key(s);
2468  auto bounds = side_to_elem_map.equal_range(key);
2469 
2470  if (bounds.first != bounds.second)
2471  {
2472  // Get the side for this element
2473  el->side_ptr(my_side, s);
2474 
2475  // Look at all the entries with an equivalent key
2476  while (bounds.first != bounds.second)
2477  {
2478  // Get the potential element
2479  Elem * neighbor = const_cast<Elem *>(bounds.first->second.first);
2480 
2481  // Get the side for the neighboring element
2482  const unsigned int ns = bounds.first->second.second;
2483  neighbor->side_ptr(their_side, ns);
2484  //libmesh_assert(my_side.get());
2485  //libmesh_assert(their_side.get());
2486 
2487  // If found a match with my side
2488  //
2489  // We need special tests here for 1D:
2490  // since parents and children have an equal
2491  // side (i.e. a node), we need to check
2492  // ns != ms, and we also check level() to
2493  // avoid setting our neighbor pointer to
2494  // any of our neighbor's descendants
2495  if ((*my_side == *their_side) &&
2496  (el->level() == neighbor->level()) &&
2497  ((el->dim() != 1) || (ns != s)))
2498  {
2499  // So share a side. Is this a mixed pair
2500  // of subactive and active/ancestor
2501  // elements?
2502  // If not, then we're neighbors.
2503  // If so, then the subactive's neighbor is
2504 
2505  if (el->subactive() ==
2506  neighbor->subactive())
2507  {
2508  // an element is only subactive if it has
2509  // been coarsened but not deleted
2510  el->set_neighbor (s,neighbor);
2511  neighbor->set_neighbor(ns,el);
2512  }
2513  else if (el->subactive())
2514  {
2515  el->set_neighbor(s,neighbor);
2516  }
2517  else if (neighbor->subactive())
2518  {
2519  neighbor->set_neighbor(ns,el);
2520  }
2521  // It's OK to invalidate the
2522  // bounds.first iterator here,
2523  // as we are immediately going
2524  // to break out of this while
2525  // loop. bounds.first will
2526  // therefore not be used for
2527  // anything else.
2528  side_to_elem_map.erase (bounds.first);
2529  break;
2530  }
2531 
2532  ++bounds.first;
2533  }
2534  }
2535  }
2536  }
2537  }
2538  }
2539  }
2540  }
2541 
2542  const bool old_allow_find_neighbors = this->allow_find_neighbors();
2543  const bool old_allow_remote_element_removal = this->allow_remote_element_removal();
2544  this->allow_find_neighbors(!skip_find_neighbors);
2545  this->allow_remote_element_removal(false);
2546  this->prepare_for_use();
2547  this->allow_find_neighbors(old_allow_find_neighbors);
2548  this->allow_remote_element_removal(old_allow_remote_element_removal);
2549 
2550  // After the stitching, we may want to clear boundary IDs from element
2551  // faces that are now internal to the mesh
2552  if (clear_stitched_boundary_ids)
2553  {
2554  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes clear bcids", "UnstructuredMesh");
2555 
2556  this->get_boundary_info().clear_stitched_boundary_side_ids(
2557  this_mesh_boundary_id, other_mesh_boundary_id, /*clear_nodeset_data=*/true);
2558  }
2559 
2560  // Return the number of nodes which were merged.
2561  return node_to_node_map.size();
2562 }

std::unique_ptr< PointLocatorBase > libMesh::MeshBase::sub_point_locator ( ) const
inherited
返回
A pointer to a subordinate PointLocatorBase object for this mesh, constructing a master PointLocator first if necessary. This should not be used in threaded or non-parallel_only code unless the master has already been constructed.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1558 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_point_locator, libMesh::MeshBase::_point_locator_close_to_point_tol, libMesh::PointLocatorBase::build(), libMesh::Threads::in_threads, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::NANOFLANN , 以及 libMesh::TREE_ELEMENTS.

参考自 libMesh::DofMap::create_dof_constraints(), libMesh::MeshFunction::init(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_consistent_distributed_nodes(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::make_coarsening_compatible(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::make_refinement_compatible(), libMesh::System::point_gradient(), libMesh::System::point_hessian(), libMesh::System::point_value() , 以及 libMesh::MeshRefinement::test_level_one().

1559 {
1560  // If there's no master point locator, then we need one.
1561  if (_point_locator.get() == nullptr)
1562  {
1563  // PointLocator construction may not be safe within threads
1564  libmesh_assert(!Threads::in_threads);
1565 
1566  // And it may require parallel communication
1567  parallel_object_only();
1568 
1569 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NANOFLANN_POINTLOCATOR
1570  _point_locator = PointLocatorBase::build(NANOFLANN, *this);
1571 #else
1572  _point_locator = PointLocatorBase::build(TREE_ELEMENTS, *this);
1573 #endif
1574 
1575  if (_point_locator_close_to_point_tol > 0.)
1576  _point_locator->set_close_to_point_tol(_point_locator_close_to_point_tol);
1577  }
1578 
1579  // Otherwise there was a master point locator, and we can grab a
1580  // sub-locator easily.
1581  return
1582 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NANOFLANN_POINTLOCATOR
1583  PointLocatorBase::build(NANOFLANN, *this, _point_locator.get());
1584 #else
1585  PointLocatorBase::build(TREE_ELEMENTS, *this, _point_locator.get());
1586 #endif
1587 }
libMesh::NANOFLANN
Definition: enum_point_locator_type.h:39
libMesh::Threads::in_threads
bool in_threads
A boolean which is true iff we are in a Threads:: function It may be useful to assert(!Threadsin_thre...
Definition: threads.C:32
libMesh::TREE_ELEMENTS
Definition: enum_point_locator_type.h:37
libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(ctx)
libMesh::MeshBase::_point_locator
std::unique_ptr< PointLocatorBase > _point_locator
A PointLocator class for this mesh.

virtual bool libMesh::MeshBase::subclass_locally_equals ( const MeshBase &  other_mesh) const

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::locally_equals().

void libMesh::MeshBase::subdomain_ids ( std::set< subdomain_id_type > &  ids,
const bool  global = true 
) const
inherited

Constructs a list of all subdomain identifiers in the local mesh if global == false, and in the global mesh if global == true (default).

Subdomains correspond to separate subsets of the mesh which could correspond e.g. to different materials in a solid mechanics application, or regions where different physical processes are important. The subdomain mapping is independent from the parallel decomposition.

Unpartitioned elements are included in the set in the case that global == true. If global == false, the unpartitioned elements are not included because unpartitioned elements do not have a sense of locality.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 897 行定义.

参考 libMesh::ParallelObject::comm().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::n_local_subdomains(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_subdomains() , 以及 libMesh::TecplotIO::TecplotIO().

898 {
899  // This requires an inspection on every processor
900  if (global)
901  parallel_object_only();
902 
903  ids.clear();
904 
905  for (const auto & elem : this->active_local_element_ptr_range())
906  ids.insert(elem->subdomain_id());
907 
908  if (global)
909  {
910  // Only include the unpartitioned elements if the user requests the global IDs.
911  // In the case of the local subdomain IDs, it doesn't make sense to include the
912  // unpartitioned elements because said elements do not have a sense of locality.
913  for (const auto & elem : this->active_unpartitioned_element_ptr_range())
914  ids.insert(elem->subdomain_id());
915 
916  // Some subdomains may only live on other processors
917  this->comm().set_union(ids);
918  }
919 }
libMesh::ParallelObject::comm
const Parallel::Communicator & comm() const
Definition: parallel_object.h:97

std::map<dof_id_type, const MeshBase::elemset_type *> libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes
protectedinherited

Map from "element set code" to list of set ids to which that element belongs (and vice-versa).

Remarks: 1.) The elemset code is a dof_id_type because (if used) it is stored as an extra_integer (named "elemset_code") on all elements, and extra_integers are of type dof_id_type. Elements which do not belong to any set should be assigned an elemset code of DofObject::invalid_id. 2.) Element sets can be thought of as a generalization of the concept of a subdomain. Subdomains have the following restrictions: a.) A given element can only belong to a single subdomain b.) When using Exodus file input/output, subdomains are (unfortunately) tied to the concept of exodus element blocks, which consist of a single geometric element type, somewhat limiting their generality. 3.) The user is responsible for filling in the values of this map in a consistent manner, unless the elemsets are read in from an Exodus file, in which case the elemset codes will be set up automatically. The codes can basically be chosen arbitrarily, with the one requirement that elements which belong to no sets should have a set code of DofObject::invalid_id. 4.) We also keep a list of all the elemset ids which have been added in order to support O(1) performance behavior in n_elemsets() calls.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1889 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::add_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemset_codes(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemsets(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::locally_equals(), libMesh::MeshBase::MeshBase() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::operator=().

std::map<MeshBase::elemset_type, dof_id_type> libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes_inverse_map
protectedinherited

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1890 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::add_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::MeshBase() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::operator=().

unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::_n_parts
protectedinherited

The number of partitions the mesh has.

This is set by the partitioners, and may not be changed directly by the user.

注解
The number of partitions need not equal this->n_processors(), consider for example the case where you simply want to partition a mesh on one processor and view the result in GMV.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1767 行定义.

std::unique_ptr<PointLocatorBase> libMesh::MeshBase::_point_locator
mutableprotectedinherited

A PointLocator class for this mesh.

This will not actually be built unless needed. Further, since we want our point_locator() method to be const (yet do the dynamic allocating) this needs to be mutable. Since the PointLocatorBase::build() member is used, and it operates on a constant reference to the mesh, this is OK.

std::unique_ptr<BoundaryInfo> libMesh::MeshBase::boundary_info
protectedinherited

This class holds the boundary information.

It can store nodes, edges, and faces with a corresponding id that facilitates setting boundary conditions.

Direct access to this class is now officially deprecated and will be removed in future libMesh versions. Use the get_boundary_info() accessor instead.
